title: Cam's module linter 5000
body:
We've talked a lot about enforcing separation between different "modules", here's a Kondo linter that will actually enforce that. Configurable directly inside the Kondo config file.

Next step is to consolidate all the externally-referenced stuff into a smaller set of "core" or "API" namespaces and then enable this for all of our different top-level "modules". Then we'll have a real catalog of the de facto public interfaces of all of our modules
```
$ clj-kondo --lint src/metabase/query_processor/middleware/add_implicit_joins.clj
src/metabase/query_processor/middleware/add_implicit_joins.clj:12:5: warning: Namespace metabase.lib.metadata is not allowed in the metabase.query-processor module. [:metabase/ns-module-checker]
src/metabase/query_processor/middleware/add_implicit_joins.clj:13:5: warning: Namespace metabase.lib.metadata.protocols is not allowed in the metabase.query-processor module. [:metabase/ns-module-checker]
src/metabase/query_processor/middleware/add_implicit_joins.clj:14:5: warning: Namespace metabase.lib.schema.common is not allowed in the metabase.query-processor module. [:metabase/ns-module-checker]
src/metabase/query_processor/middleware/add_implicit_joins.clj:15:5: warning: Namespace metabase.lib.schema.id is not allowed in the metabase.query-processor module. [:metabase/ns-module-checker]
src/metabase/query_processor/middleware/add_implicit_joins.clj:16:5: warning: Namespace metabase.lib.util.match is not allowed in the metabase.query-processor module. [:metabase/ns-module-checker]
linting took 48ms, errors: 0, warnings: 5
```

DEV-250

labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

Currently they're being checked and causing failures e.g. [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8946928817/job/24578241049?pr=42250#step:6:423).", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 6, 19, 2, 14, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2101255946, 'issue_id': 2278646287, 'author': 'camsaul', 'body': '>Another non-pressing concern I have is around performance. I'm a little nervous that once we replace all the "opt out" config with the minimally supporting definitions, that the linter will get quite slow. I guess we can live with some slowness, or can optimize it as we need to, but some of the structural differences in the other PR were oriented around performance. All pretty speculative though, especially as I don't have much SCI experience. We can worry about performance if and when it's a problem, we normally run Kondo in `--parallel` (`bin/kondo.sh`) so it still seems plenty fast locally and on CI Kondo finishes way before tests either way. I don't think walking a data structure as simple as the `ns` `:require` form can possibly be slow unless we write really bad code Premature optimization am I right', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 8, 19, 12, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2101257432, 'issue_id': 2278646287, 'author': 'camsaul', 'body': "> The other core difference in approach with the other PR is around extensibility, in particular towards grouping, nesting, and more complex visibility semantics. Since it's early days my preference is to design for flexibility, given the relative complexity is minor and rather subjective. I do like how direct this implementation is in contrast though. I don't want to let the perfect be the enemy of the good, something simple that we can run with is better than something that supports theoretical use cases that we can't actually start using yet. We can always add more stuff later if we need it. I don't think we need to start worrying about nested modules or module groups just yet", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 8, 19, 13, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2101354157, 'issue_id': 2278646287, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@camsaul Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 8, 20, 16, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2644232755, 'issue_id': 2278646287, 'author': 'camsaul', 'body': 'DEV-250', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2025, 2, 7, 22, 19, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: [EXPERIMENTAL] Record session timezones for JDBC Connections to avoid unneeded updates
body:
We execute something like

```sql
ALTER SESSION SET TIME ZONE = 'US/Pacific';
```

every single time we run a query against a data warehouse, that's pretty silly and wasteful when that value rarely if ever changes. For some databases like Snowflake it can take hundreds of milliseconds to execute SQL that more often than not is a no-op. 

Ideally, we'd be able to record whether we set a given connection to a given timezone or not and only execute that statement to update the session timezone if it hasn't been set yet or has changed.

There's not really any consistent way to set this across different types of `java.sql.Connection`, so I experimented with recording it in a synchronized weak map like

```
;; key = (unwrapped) java.sql.Connection, value = Clojure map
(java.util.Collections/synchronizedMap (java.util.WeakHashMap.))
```

but ultimately decided it's nicer to just create yet another proxy `java.sql.Connection` class that implements `clojure.lang.IMeta`, `IObj`, and `IReference` and store it directly alongside the connection instead so we don't have to worry about locking or weak references.

This is now working nicely; hopefully this PR will give me a sense of whether this makes a noticeable performance impact in CI or not.

As part of this I had to upgrade c3p0 because the upstream fix for https://github.com/swaldman/c3p0/issues/134 is only available in the new stuff

title: New Recents API Format
body:
resolves #41957 

The way this works is by querying `recent_views` for the last 20 of each sort of model. This query joins with report_card so we can differentiate questions (cards) from datasets (models).

Then each one is passed through post-process, a multimethod that dispatches on the model (with a distinction between cards and datasets) which does some classification, and adds details to each RecentViews/Item.



### Tasks
- [x] update return from /activity/recent_views
- [x] track models as distinct from cards
- [x] update recents to preserve inside category (not just last 30 whatevers, but 20 cards, dashboards, models, collections, and tables)
- [x] add collection events for:
    - [x] collection creation, 
    - [x] moving card, 
    - [x] dash, 
    - [x] collection)
- [x] make sure we are pruning `recent_views` properly
- [x] update /popular_items return shape to match recent_views
- [x] tests
- [x] return `moderated_status` on cards, models, (and maybe dashboards)
- [x] filter out archived / inactive values
- [x] add description to all models
- [x] more tests
author: escherize
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Open the expression editor if all metrics are selected
body: Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42176 Also fixes the selected state of metric items in the picker. How to verify: - New -> Question -> Select metric - The aggregation clause should be automatically added in the query - Click + for a new aggregation - The expression editor should be automatically opened Please note that it suggests aggregation operators which is wrong, but this is a separate issue.
author: ranquild
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Fix editing an existing metric
body: Currently you cannot edit the query definition of a metric because of a bug. This PR fixes the issue. How to verify: - Open a metric - Click Edit metric definition - You would see the metric query instead of a query based on the metric

title: Reserve component height with defaults from visualization type in embedded questions
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42199

### Description

The embedded component currently does not render unless the component's parent is a fixed-height flexbox (see the above issue), and the user cannot set the height. This PR defines a fixed default height based on [the Figma spec](https://www.figma.com/file/JgPUvIfWeNzTiA0PL4QeUl/Viz-card-default-and-min-sizes?type=design&node-id=240%3A5607&mode=design&t=DR5wJ4aS3JqZrKrs-1), and allows user to override the default via the `height` prop.

### How to verify

- Checkout the `remove-height-workaround` branch in the demo app
- Navigate to `/admin/internal/kitchen-sink` in the demo. In this branch, the kitchen sink does not explicitly set the component height for the charts, so it falls back to the default value.
- Add the `height` prop, and the height should be customizable.

### Demo

![CleanShot 2567-05-07 at 23 19 28@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/90d9e081-f8be-4b8a-8fa1-1d230586d669)

This PR consolidates the `engines` related code, and converts the related util file to TS. Back when I had to use these utils for the notebook native query preview sidebar, I ran into a lot of ambiguity. Things will hopefully be a bit more clear after this PR.

This PR also removes some unused functions.

All tests in CI should still work.

title: Fix InteractiveQuestion loader show no question before loaded
body:
### Description

Reported on [Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1714723290124359)

The problem occurred because how we set `loading` state to false. We do that after we wait for `initializeQBRaw` action to be finished which isn't enough. A lot of downstream functions aren't even `await`ed. So we can only rely on `queryResults` to be there.

### How to verify

Use customer zero with this the SDK built with this PR, when going to the product detail page (clicking on a product on the product list page). The first bar chart shouldn't show `no question` error before it's actually loaded.

### Demo

#### Before
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/9226cbed-d78a-4a9d-903c-923d9fd21a3a

#### After
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/b5c0223f-0074-47b2-9f82-8fc7af193e6b

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Define public metabase theme and Mantine transformer for embedding SDK
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42201

### Description

Defines a standalone `MetabaseTheme` theme object. Modifies the `MetabaseProvider` to transforms the input `MetabaseTheme` theme object into a `MantineThemeOverride`, for consumption by the `ThemeProvider`.

This PR also moves the `font` configuration in `SDKConfig` to `fontFamily` theme option for consistency.

### How to verify

- Navigate to `basic-theming-public-theme-type` branch on the demo app.
- Navigate to the `AppProvider` component, verify the new theme configuration are in use.
- Change the color schemes or font family to make it easy to test. See the demo below.

### Demo

With the following theme option applied, notice that the loading spinner is now lime green (`brand`), and the chart text is yellow (`text-dark`).

```ts
const theme: MetabaseTheme = {
  fontFamily: "Lato",
  fontSize: "1rem",
  lineHeight: "1.1rem",
  colors: {
    brand: "lime",
    "text-dark": "yellow",
    "text-light": "green",
  },
}
```

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/67743c9d-2f75-4dbd-b555-59dfc26c4531

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: HOLY GRAIL OF PRs UNBLOCK PARALLEL-TEST-SAFE SETTINGS!!!!!!!!!!!1 MASSIVE TEST PERFORMANCE IMPROVEMENT!!!!!
body:
#33616 is my white whale! 

Two things were blocking us from introducing a thread-safe version of `mt/with-temporary-setting-values`:

1. changing `report-timezone` calls `driver/notify-database-updated`, which in turn nukes all open connection pools for all JDBC-based databases... originally this was because Snowflake set timezone as a connection property, but it turns out this was actually not needed at all since none of our DBs set it as a connection property anymore. There is no need to nuke connection pools if connection details don't actually change at all. This is also a massive performance improvement for tests since we can actually reuse connections for more than like 2 seconds. This PR updates things so we only nuke the pools if connection details actually change or when we delete the Database (via a new method `notify-database-will-be-deleted!`)
2. Snowflake was setting `week_start` as a connection property which meant its connection pool got nuked every time we changed the `start-of-week` Setting... instead we can just set it as a session property every time we check out a connection at the same time we set Session timezone. This means there are officially no longer any settings that should affect any database's connection properties in any way and thus no setting changes can possibly lead to connection pool invalidation

So not only is this 10x faster since we can finally reuse connection pools for the entire test run, we are now finally unblocked from implementing #33616. I'll do a follow-on PR to make that thread-safe by default and respect `mt/test-helpers-set-global-values!` if you actually need it to make thread-unsafe changes

title: Allow Admins to clean up uploaded tables in bulk
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42069

### Description

Adds admin ui (behind a new token feature flag) to allow enterprise users to manage uploaded tables in bulk:
- Can sort table by any column
- can delete any single item, or any bulk selection

![uploadManagement](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/9eb4f2d3-1702-4f48-819e-0d1c00ea9299)

Not yet implemented:
- success/error toasts 
- loading state
- pagination (not supported by API) - should be ok for a few thousand tables for now


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: 41901 command palette search view all
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41901
### Description
Adds a "view all results" action to the search results section. This should always appear at the top of the search section.

If the only items in the command palette are search results (and the docs action), the palette should highlight the 1st search result

### How to verify

1. Toggle the palette
2. Search for a few queries. You should see a "view and filter all x results" When there are only search results, the second result should be highlighted. Otherwise, things should behave as normal

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: 42078 palette search links
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42078

### Description
Wraps search results and recent items in the command palette with a Link component. This allows for right click -> open in new tab type interactions that the browsers natively support for links

### How to verify

1. Open the command palette
2. Right click on an item in recents and open in a new tab. `ctrl + click` also works

### Demo
![chrome_s9lNWnqBVF](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/bdd0d287-d3e8-4a61-9134-5e03e35614b5)

### Checklist
Tests are a bit spotty... it doesn't seem like cypress supports context menu navigation. Currently I updated unit tests to ensure that links are rendered, but there may be room for more here
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Enable Mongo tests to run in the stress-test action
body:
This PR makes it possible for Mongo related E2E tests to run in the stress-test scenario.

The downside could be adding of overhead in the "snapshot" creation phase.
Also, if Mongo starts acting up, we might see the failure to create snapshots in the first place.

The alternative would be to add another input to the action that explicitly controls the Mongo env.

P.S. I used this exact variable when testing Mongo E2E test in this run:
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8924913940/job/24512349673

title: Fix E2E Repro #42065 failure
body:
The test was filing because the drill-through filtering does not work in CI.
1. If the table has 2 PKs, and you click on any of them, we apply the filter with its value directly.
2. OTOH, if there's only 1PK and you click on it, we open the Object detail modal

The second scenario was happening in the CI, while the first one is happening locally.
See the screenshot from the CI and note that the second `ID` column is not formatted as the primary key.
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/97b1c889-1580-41b8-8a98-5fd085b7f077)
I don't have any explanation for this behavior, but it could be the syncing issue.

The only way to solve this issue was to completely remove the "drill-through" filtering from the repro. That's ok because we're still explicitly reproducing/testing two related issues (notebook filtering and chill mode filtering).

Here's a stress-test workflow that confirms 10/10 runs were green after the fix ‚úÖ 
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8924913940/job/24512349673
author: nemanjaglumac
labels: [('.CI & Tests', ''), ('flaky-test-fix', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Apply mantine color palette to cartesian chart labels
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41949

### Description

Cartesian charts currently get their color from the `color` function from `lib/colors/palette.ts`, but these colors are hard-coded and not overrideable by users. This PR adds the `use-palette` hook that extracts a subset of color palettes from a Mantine theme, and apply the palette into the cartesian chart.

### How to verify

1. Go to the `basic-theming` branch in the demo app
2. Go to the `/admin/internal/kitchen-sink` page
3. Verify that the theme color in `AppProvider` is set to a custom value, e.g. text-dark is hotpink:

```ts
  colors: {
    brand: colorTuple("hotpink"),
    "text-dark": colorTuple("hotpink"),
    "text-light": colorTuple("hotpink"),
  },
```

4. The 3 chart labels should now be in hotpink, instead of black.

### Screenshot

Labels used to use the hard-coded text-dark color, but now it becomes hotpink as defined above.

![CleanShot 2567-05-02 at 19 01 08@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/82fdb5a4-0ae7-4362-96e6-737a688e109d)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix mongo OOM during sync
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42133

The big memory usage comes from the `mongo.util/do-find` method, which return a vector. We should use a lazy seq instead.

This is a regression and introduced by https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/38017

Here is a script to demonstrate memory usage before and after the changes.

```clojure
(require 
 '[toucan2.core :as t2]
 '[metabase.util.log :as log]
 '[metabase.sync.sync-metadata.fields :as sync.fields])

(def db (t2/select-one :model/Database :engine :mongo))

(future
 (def max-memory-usage (atom 0))
 (doseq [_ (range 100)]
   (let [memory-usage (float (/ (- (.. Runtime getRuntime totalMemory) (.. Runtime getRuntime freeMemory)) 1024 1024))]
     (swap! max-memory-usage max memory-usage)
     (log/info (format "Memory usage: %f MB, Max memory usage: %f MB" memory-usage @max-memory-usage)))
   (Thread/sleep 500)))

(do
  (log/info "Start")
  (sync.fields/sync-fields! db)
  (log/info "Done"))
```

Before:
```
2024-05-02 08:19:48,656 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Start
2024-05-02 08:19:48,982 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1012.117493 MB, Max memory usage: 1404.911377 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:49,483 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1901.464355 MB, Max memory usage: 1901.464355 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:49,986 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2566.096924 MB, Max memory usage: 2566.096924 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:50,491 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2572.239014 MB, Max memory usage: 2572.239014 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:50,993 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2578.385010 MB, Max memory usage: 2578.385010 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:51,497 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2584.527100 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:52,002 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2409.627441 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:52,508 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2415.769531 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:53,009 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2421.915527 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:53,512 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2428.057617 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:54,017 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2434.203613 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:54,519 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2440.345459 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:55,023 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2446.491455 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:55,525 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2452.633545 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:56,030 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2458.779541 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:56,531 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2464.921387 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:57,036 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 2471.067383 MB, Max memory usage: 2584.527100 MB
2024-05-02 08:19:57,323 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Done
```


After
```
2024-05-02 08:18:48,387 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Start
2024-05-02 08:18:48,656 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1933.911987 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:49,157 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 891.292480 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:49,662 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1117.596191 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:50,167 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1250.718262 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:50,672 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1478.044189 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:51,177 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1705.374268 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:51,678 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1932.700195 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:52,179 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 748.504089 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:52,681 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 975.960144 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:53,186 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1158.104126 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:53,688 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1385.434082 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:54,189 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1612.760132 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:54,694 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1745.882080 MB, Max memory usage: 1933.911987 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:55,200 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1971.162109 MB, Max memory usage: 1971.162109 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:55,704 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 847.578308 MB, Max memory usage: 1971.162109 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:56,205 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1042.651367 MB, Max memory usage: 1971.162109 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:56,710 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1208.026245 MB, Max memory usage: 1971.162109 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:57,215 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Memory usage: 1435.356323 MB, Max memory usage: 1971.162109 MB
2024-05-02 08:18:57,518 INFO local.mongo-oom-sync-fields :: Done
```

You can see that using lazy seq the memory usage barely increases at all.

title: Add recents to Browse models table
body:
Adds a table of recently viewed models to the Browse models table

Currently only 5 models are shown, but this will change once the relevant endpoint changes (this work is currently ongoing).

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/130925/33a9b8ec-0cbf-4a88-963c-065c04dd0e66)

Note that the Recents table and the table below it use different loading wrappers.

Closes #42632

title: Support `Offset()` as an expression with no breakouts [backend]
body:
Follow-on to #41346

Fixes #42323

Backend support for using `offset()` as a plain expression (as opposed to an aggregation or in an aggregation expression)

Most of the changes to make this work are actually in #42302, this PR is mostly just a few more small tweaks and extra backend tests.

FE work will have to be done separately, I'm not currently planning on trying to tackle it so maybe someone from QC can update things once this lands

title: Window functions should use all breakouts except first for partitioning
body:
When I implemented #2862 in #41340 earlier in the 50 cycle I had it partition by all breakouts except the first, and order by the last breakout; this behavior was confusing and product asked me to change it to order by the first breakout and partition by all the other ones. See this Slack thread https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C05MPF0TM3L/p1714084449574689

Since this hasn't gone out yet it doesn't hurt to change the behavior of this stuff now.

Fixes #42003

title: docs - view data and create queries
body:
First pass on documenting the split data permissions.

- Documents the new data permission settings: `View data` and `Create queries`.
- Adds a doc explaining the migration.
- Spins off impersonation docs into their own page.
- Updates adjacent docs (e.g., interactive embedding quick start).

title: 41994 command pallet search descriptions
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41994

### Description
This PR makes a pretty big change to the Command Palette under the hood, but the end result for the user should simply be that descriptions are now added to search results in the list. This was not originally working properly as on occasion, we would get items in the list that were sized incorrectly. From my digging, it seems that the virtual list would only re-calculate item heights when the count of items changed, and when you searched for something that only gave 1 result, the length of the items list would stay the same

The get around this, I copied the `KBarResults` component and removed the usage of virtualization (we really shouldn't need it anyways). This keeps the API as close to the documentation as possible, while giving us the functionality we need.

This PR also moves the search query into the component that actually wants it, rather than passing it in. 

### How to verify

1. Open the command palette and search for an entity
2. We should see a description rendered in the item

### Demo
![chrome_gVJCYehp82](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/5ab7e691-6f8c-4c47-b8cc-e5ea9d86b724)

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: npfitz
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: [QP] Support `:temporal-unit` parameters on MBQL queries
body:
This is a new parameter `:type` (and `:widget-type`) to choose a time
granularity (a `:temporal-unit`, eg. `month`, `day`, `day-of-week`)
which should replace the unit on the target field for the parameter.

The target field should be a breakout with a temporal type (date,
datetime) that's compatible with the input unit. The value of the
parameter should be a string or keyword naming one of the units:
`"month"`, `:month`.
author: bshepherdson
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Linkify rows in Browse models table
body:
### TL;DR

This PR makes the rows of the ModelsTable component clickable, routing to the respective item's url.

### What changed?

Created a new styled component, `ModelTableRow`, to encapsulate the styling code for table rows in `ModelsTable`. Now, when a user clicks on a row in the table, they are redirected to the URL of the item that row represents. It also prevents click propagation when the collection is clicked.

### How to test?

Visual testing can be performed by checking if clicking on table rows redirects to correct URL and whether the styling behaves as expected.

### Why make this change?

This change enhances the user experience by allowing easier navigation.

(Graphite's AI wrote this PR description btw)
author: rafpaf
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Allow multiple values for string operators in the query builder
body:
This PR is a part of the milestone 1 of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41956.

It expands the multi-select filter capabilities in the query builder to the "contains", "does not contain", "starts with" and "ends with" operators. This behavior was previously possible only for "is" and "is not" operators.

The scope of this PR is bringing the behavior up to par with the previous operators, as per the definition of the Milestone 1.
author: nemanjaglumac

title: Snowplow event for extract action via notebook shortcut
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42093

Depends on code from, https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41774, so review that first.

### Description

Adds an analytics event that fires when the custom column is created from the expression editor in the notebook via the extract shortcut.

### To reproduce

1. New question -> Sample data -> Orders
2. Add new column
3. Select `Extract column` shortcut
4. pick an extraction
5. Verify the snowplow event was triggered
author: romeovs
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2088277267, 'issue_id': 2273297708, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

Status Complete ‚ÜóÔ∏é
Commit 06a682ec3a7b0625ba1c1ba26807e01fe37e9b2b
Results
‚ö†Ô∏è 7 Flaky
‚úÖ 2454 Passed
', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 1, 10, 43, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2088397865, 'issue_id': 2273297708, 'author': 'bshepherdson', 'body': "> @romeovs this looks wrong. Why? Because we have an abstraction (extraction tag) and then we need a mapping to the actual expression name. It means that the abstraction is leaky and doesn't work. Furthermore, it creates more issues. > > If we need the actual expression name, let's change the `tag` to be the name of the underlying expression. @bshepherdson please take a look at this. It's not the case that an extraction corresponds 1-1 with an expression function. Some of them are nested - indeed the current extractions for `Day of week`, `Month of year` and `Quarter of year` expand to eg. `[:month-name {} [:month {} column]]`. That said, I think the table in `extractions.ts` is the wrong approach. If we want to list all the functions used by the extraction, then I think the right answer is to call `Lib.expressionParts(Lib.extractionExpression(theExtraction))` and walk that tree to get all the `operator`s.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 1, 12, 28, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

bshepherdson on (2024-05-01 12:28:11 UTC): It's not the case that an extraction corresponds 1-1 with an expression function. Some of them are nested - indeed the current extractions for `Day of week`, `Month of year` and `Quarter of year` expand to eg. `[:month-name {} [:month {} column]]`. That said, I think the table in `extractions.ts` is the wrong approach. If we want to list all the functions used by the extraction, then I think the right answer is to call `Lib.expressionParts(Lib.extractionExpression(theExtraction))` and walk that tree to get all the `operator`s.

title: Fix Bigquery can't sync materialized views
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42008

```(.getTableDefinition table)```
- returns: MaterializedViewDefinition if table is a materialized view ([src](https://github.com/googleapis/java-bigquery/blob/8fa6d279bc8dd8fc11fd7f0ebadcbeca7f88ef42/google-cloud-bigquery/src/main/java/com/google/cloud/bigquery/MaterializedViewDefinition.java#L24))
- returns: StandardTableDefinition if table is a normal table ([doc](https://cloud.google.com/java/docs/reference/google-cloud-bigquery/latest/com.google.cloud.bigquery.StandardTableDefinition))

Currently, we're annotation the returned type as `StandardTableDefinition`, which is wrong for materialized, and that's why we get the casting error.
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Fix LegacyMetric/Segment macroexpansion with definitions using ancient MBQL
body:
The `expand-macros` middleware wasn't calling normalize on LegacyMetric/Segment definitions, which could lead to errors if the definitions were super legacy MBQL e.g. MBQL 2 or MBQL 3.

IRL I don't think this affected anything since the JVM metadata provider should have been calling normalize on these columns, but it did break in tests using mock metadata providers.
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: SCIM-scoped API key
body:
* Adds `:scope` to API keys and adds the ability to create a `:scim`-scoped key. Also drops the NOT NULL constraint on `api_key.user_id`
* Adds `+scim-auth` ring middleware which checks the API key passed in the `Authentication` header
* Creates a basic enterprise namespace structure for SCIM

title: combo stacked chart
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41976 Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/12008 ### Description - In Combo charts, on the `Display` tab, add a new radio setting: - `Bar and area stacking` - `Don't stack` - `Stack` - `Stack - 100%` - If `Stack` or `Stack - 100%` is selected then: - All series with a `Display type` set to `bar` should be stacked together. - All series with a `Display type` set to `area` should be stacked together. - But series with a `Display type` set to `line` should be unaffected. - If `Stack - 100%` is chosen, if there are any series set to `line`, there should be two y-axes: - one from 0% to 100% that the stacked bars/areas should be associated with, - and the other that should depict the scale and measure of the line series. ### How to verify - Create a multiple series combo chart with at least 5 series - Make two of them bars, make the other two areas, keep 1 line series - Enable stacking - Ensure areas stacked with each other, bars stacked with each other - Hover areas: ensure the tooltip shows area series only - Hover bars: ensure the tooltip shows bar series only - Hover line: ensure it shows a default key-value tooltip with all values - Switch to Stack ‚Äî 100% - Ensure left y-axis is normalized and used for stacked areas and bars - Ensure right y-axis is used for the line series ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: alxnddr
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: API-based branching poc
body:
This now covers most branched card use cases. Notable exceptions are: 

- adding branch-created cards to dashboards
- listing branch-created cards in collections (they wont be visible now)
- Search
- Recents
- Serialization


## These 4 main workflows are working nicely, though üéâ

1. create a branch, update 1 card, run the card query, publish the branch, delete the branch (note: update includes moving it into the trash)
2. create a branch, create a card, publish the branch, delete the branch
3. create a branch, create card A, update card A, publish the branch, delete the branch
4. create a branch, create card A, update card A, create card B, update card B, publish the branch, delete the branch
author: escherize
labels: [('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Recents Picker Tab
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39528

### Description

Adds a recents tab to the EntityPicker, which will show recent items of the relevant entity type.

**Dashboards (add question to dashboard modal)**

![Screen Shot 2024-05-14 at 6 33 04 AM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/4631bf9c-bf99-494c-94f9-a47014804f9c)

**Collections (new dashboard modal)**

![Screen Shot 2024-05-14 at 6 32 47 AM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/f67d2067-b2f2-4907-a344-cd7bbe08fa6c)


**Questions (while editing a dashboard - replace question modal)**

![Screen Shot 2024-05-14 at 7 13 09 AM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/1a591071-fa05-45ea-aaac-c125de239f67)


## Known Limitations
- the state of the recents api is such that we can't smartly disable invalid items when moving
- the create new button should be disabled on the recents tab, because the current UX is a little wonky.


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Preserve saved parameter operator type
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41658

### Description

If use changes filter type for the saved dashboard and saved parameter mapping and then switches back to the saved parameter type, we should restore the saved parameter value.

UX might be not the best (I presume showing a link or a button to reset state would be better), but lets see how it goes

### How to verify

- create a dashboard with a filter and question (orders table and text filter work)
- create a mapping between card and filter, set operator to "does not contain" and label to "text 123", save dashboard
- edit dashboard, set another parameter type (e.g. number), then change again to Text or Category -> label and operator should be restored to the saved values

### Demo



https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/125459446/d51aa776-a0b2-4232-80ae-f6997fb9670b





### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
- [x] [stress test](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8909448663/job/24466830272)
- [x] [stress test for second test](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8925151406)

title: MLv2: Simplify MetadataProvider protocols (16 methods/3 protocols => 7 methods/2 protocols)
body:
- Consolidate the 12 methods in the two `MetadataProvider` and `BulkMetadataProvider` protocols into 5 methods in a single protocol -- instead of separate methods to fetch a Field/Card/Table/LegacyMetric/Segment as well as a bulk method, just have the metadata providers implement only the bulk method and add helper functions for fetching single objects of different types
- Remove unused `cached-database` and `store-database!` methods from the `CachedMetadataProvider` protocol
- Finally finish the cleanup of moving everything away from using vars like `lib.metadata/LegacyMetricMetadata` to the schema keywords e.g. `::lib.schema.metadata/legacy-metric`
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Optimize loading of admin permissions pages (add skip_fields flag to database metadata endpoint)
body:
Adds a `skip_fields` boolean flag to `GET /api/database/:id/metadata` which, when `true`, skips hydrating database tables with field metadata.

This will be used by the permissions admin page when fetching a database's tables. The perms page doesn't need field information, but this endpoint is significantly slow for some DBs on stats, seemingly due to having a large number of fields. More discussion in Slack: https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C064EB1UE5P/p1714423801533629
author: noahmoss
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Upload module contract
body:
This PR drafts a module contract (aka module README) for the `metabase.upload` module. Its format could be an anchor point for many more modules to come, so it would be great to get some early feedback on it.

Click [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/add-upload-module-guide/src/metabase/upload.clj) for the main "module contract" file.

A module contract includes 3 sections:
- what you can use this module for
- stable guarantees (what you can depend on)
- unstable internals (what you can't depend on)

And a list of public vars (functions, constants, and schemas) of the namespace.
author: calherries
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: add percent change to timeseries tooltip
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41979

### Description

Implements [Include percent change in tooltips for time series + funnel charts](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Include-percent-change-in-tooltips-for-time-series-funnel-charts-c9f38dbe0bf9457aa1e566e267521a1d). We show this row in the tooltip for all funnel charts, and for line, area, bar, and waterfall charts with a timeseries x-axis. We will not show it after a gap in the data, e.g. if the previous month is missing, do not show the change since we have nothing to calculate it against. We also don't show it all for scatter plots, since scatter plots can have unaggregated data where it's ambigious what to compare against.

### How to verify

1. Create a line/area/bar chart with timeseries x-axis (e.g. orders sum of total grouped by month).
2. Confirm that series tooltip contains the percent change row (except if there is no data on previous row).
3. Create a funnel chart.
4. Confirm series tooltip contains both retained and change rows below the divider.

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/37751258/2d24f3cb-6253-443b-adf8-1e7cbe6b7493

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: EmmadUsmani
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: fixes replace missing values with zeros on timeseries charts
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/42030 ### Description Fixes "replace missing values => zero" series setting. Previously, it was only replacing missing values for existing in the dataset x-values. However, it does not produce desired charts on time series datasets with gaps in x-values, for instace, when dataset has Janurary and March, it would be expected to see zero value for February when this setting is enabled. ### How to verify Ensure for the following dataset when "replace missing values" is zero, it shows zeros for 2021 and 2022: ```sql SELECT DATE '2020-01-01' AS x, 10 AS y UNION ALL SELECT DATE '2023-01-01', 10 UNION ALL SELECT DATE '2024-01-01', 10 ``` ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: alxnddr

title: Dashboard Param Values Common Impl for Embedding/Preview Embedding
body:
Fixes #41635

This PR adds the following endpoint to the preview-embed api:

`GET /api/preview_embed/dashboard/:token/params/:param-key/values`

Refactor the embedding api namespace to allow a bit of reuse between the embedding api and the embedding preview api. In some cases, the implementations are not identical (in terms of the shape of data expected/endpoints available), so this is a first step to making them the same.

Related:

https://www.notion.so/metabase/Make-embedding-preview-behave-consistently-with-actual-static-embeds-855353d8e5e8411d8164c7ac563c7d2f

title: Fix flaky dashboard subscription test
body:
Fixes a flaky test in the dashboard subscription e2e test suite.

The test creates a dashboard subscription for two users, sends a subscription email, opens the maildev client, and unsubscribes a user from the subscription. The test asserts that the "non-user@example.com" user is always the one who gets unsubscribed, but sometimes, the test fails as it actually unsubscribes the other user. It happens because we're just opening the first email in maildev, but the order of emails sent isn't deterministic: sometimes user A's email is first, and sometimes it's vice versa. I couldn't find a simple way to distinguish the two emails in maildev without adding way more logic to the test, so the PR just removes the other user

[Stress tested (20 times)](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8898302129)
author: kulyk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('flaky-test-fix', ''), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Expose theme property to metabase provider in embedding SDK
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41948

### Description

Adds an optional `theme` option to `MetabaseProvider`, allowing SDK users to add their own Mantine themes. The theme is then merged with Metabase's default theme overrides in our `ThemeProvider`.

### How to verify

See the `basic-theming` branch in the demo app. This branch does the following:

1. Pass in Mantine's theme options to the `MetabaseProvider` in the demo app.
2. Modify the `colors.brand` or `colors.text-dark` theme option in the demo app.
3. Color in `colors.brand` should be applied to the Mantine loader components.

### Screenshot

Notice the loader is now pink instead of light blue.

![CleanShot 2567-04-30 at 23 35 21@2x](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/4714175/5f422524-dec6-47e4-9792-858f1f37e08d)

### Notes

- We should review how we write tests for this as well. For example, verifying that adding `colors.brand` will change the rendered button's color. I'll work on the tests next.
author: heypoom
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Fix flaky dashboard repro tests (issue 39863)
body:
Fixes flaky repro tests for #39863

We had `cy.wait("@dashcardQuery")` in a couple of places where we don't actually expect a request to happen. It passed locally, but started throwing timeout errors on CI. Fixed by removing unnecessary `cy.wait` and adding assertions based on loading spinner precense.

[Stress tested (20 times)](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8898206314)

title: Migrate embedding SDK reducers to use redux toolkit's builder callback
body:
### Description

The following warning regarding reducer object notation is shown in the console. This PR migrates the reducer to use the builder callback notion.

```bash
  console.warn
    The object notation for `createReducer` is deprecated, and will be removed in RTK 2.0. Please use the 'builder callback' notation instead: https://redux-toolkit.js.org/api/createReducer

      71 | };
      72 |
    > 73 | export const sdk = createReducer(initialState, {
         |                                 ^
      74 |   [refreshTokenAsync.pending.type]: state => {
      75 |     return {
      76 |       ...state,

      at createReducer (node_modules/@reduxjs/toolkit/src/createReducer.ts:228:17)
      at Object.<anonymous> (enterprise/frontend/src/embedding-sdk/store/reducer.ts:73:33)
      at Object.require (enterprise/frontend/src/embedding-sdk/store/index.ts:14:1)
      at Object.require (enterprise/frontend/src/embedding-sdk/hooks/public/use-question-search.ts:3:1)
      at Object.require (enterprise/frontend/src/embedding-sdk/hooks/public/index.ts:3:1)
      at Object.require (enterprise/frontend/src/embedding-sdk/hooks/index.ts:1:1)
      at Object.require (enterprise/frontend/src/embedding-sdk/components/private/AppInitializeController.tsx:8:1)
      at Object.require (frontend/test/__support__/ui.tsx:15:1)
      at Object.require (enterprise/frontend/src/embedding-sdk/components/private/PublicComponentWrapper/PublicComponentWrapper.unit.spec.tsx:1:1)
```

### How to verify

- Running tests such as `yarn jest PublicComponentWrapper` should no longer show the above error.
author: heypoom
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2085669822, 'issue_id': 2271808451, 'author': 'oisincoveney', 'body': 'Does this affect types in any way?', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 30, 15, 27, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2085680540, 'issue_id': 2271808451, 'author': 'heypoom', 'body': "> Does this affect types in any way? @oisincoveney As I changed some of the `createAction` imports from `redux-actions` to `@reduxjs/toolkit`, I think the action creator type is changed slightly - but shouldn't affect the existing code. Essentially, redux-actions uses a very generic action creator type `export type ActionFunctionAny = (...args: any[]) => R;`, while redux toolkit injects the `type` metadata field and strictly defines the payload action structure.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 30, 15, 32, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2085688886, 'issue_id': 2271808451, 'author': 'npretto', 'body': "> Does this affect types in any way? AFAIR the builder pattern was made explicitly to have better type inference, as you can see with it you don't have to type the action as it infers them from the action creator", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 30, 15, 34, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2085694964, 'issue_id': 2271808451, 'author': 'oisincoveney', 'body': "> > Does this affect types in any way? > > @oisincoveney As I changed some of the `createAction` imports from `redux-actions` to `@reduxjs/toolkit`, I think the action creator type is changed slightly - but shouldn't affect the existing code. > > Essentially, redux-actions uses a very generic action creator type `export type ActionFunctionAny = (...args: any[]) => R;`, while redux toolkit injects the `type` metadata field and strictly defines the payload action structure. Sweet. Just wanted to make sure since I tried to shoehorn redux-actions with RTK. this is much nicer then üòÑ", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 30, 15, 35, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2085696672, 'issue_id': 2271808451, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

title: Remove "dataset duration" endpoint
body:
This PR removes an endpoint which was marked as unused *seven* years ago.

I would've left the endpoint on the backend and only remove the unused frontend part, but I decided to remove it for two reasons:
- It has been unused for seven years
- There are no tests for it

title: Fix invalid reducer key warning in frontend unit test's initial state
body:
[Reported on Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C505ZNNH4/p1714408885110209)

### Description

Frontend unit tests currently returns this warning. This is caused by the initial state not matching the testing mode.

```sh
    > 15 |   return configureStore({
         |                        ^
      16 |     reducer,
      17 |     preloadedState: initialState,
      18 |     middleware: getDefaultMiddleware =>

      at warning (node_modules/redux/lib/redux.js:434:13)
      at combination (node_modules/redux/lib/redux.js:557:9)
      at dispatch (node_modules/redux/lib/redux.js:296:22)
      at createStore (node_modules/redux/lib/redux.js:382:3)
      at node_modules/redux/lib/redux.js:690:31
      at createStore (node_modules/redux/lib/redux.js:162:33)
      at configureStore (node_modules/@reduxjs/toolkit/src/configureStore.ts:210:10)
      at getStore (frontend/test/__support__/entities-store.js:15:24)
      at renderWithProviders (frontend/test/__support__/ui.tsx:109:25)
      at setup (frontend/src/metabase/containers/DataPicker/tests/common.tsx:255:22)
      at Object.<anonymous> (frontend/src/metabase/containers/DataPicker/tests/DataPicker-Questions.unit.spec.ts:167:37)

  console.error
    Unexpected key "sdk" found in preloadedState argument passed to createStore. Expected to find one of the known reducer keys instead: "entities", "requests", "app", "embed", "currentUser", "settings", "undo", "upload", "auth", "metabase-api", "modal", "alert", "dashboard", "parameters", "metabot", "pulse", "qb", "reference", "revisions", "setup", "admin", "plugins". Unexpected keys will be ignored.
```

### How to verify

Run the frontend unit test again, such as `frontend/src/metabase/containers/DataPicker/tests/DataPicker-Questions.unit.spec.ts`. There shouldn't be such warning again.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: WiNloSt
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Combine columns
body: Merges the feature branch `combine-columns` into master. ([Epic](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39977) here). This branch contains work from: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/40082, unaltered, except for fixing merge conflicts. Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39980 Adds combine column drill through to the chill mode header columns. ### How to verify - Open the `Accounts` table in chill mode - Click the header of a string column (eg. `Email`, `First Name` or `Plan`) - Click `+ Combine columns` - Play around with the column editor - Click `Done` - Verify the new column is added as the last column ### Demo See video attached to [this Slack message](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0645JP1W81/p1710427151050319)

title: Fix Line or bar chart not rendering in SDK
body:
### Description

We [encountered this problem](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1714400201561839?thread_ts=1714396268.771749&cid=C063Q3F1HPF) after the ECharts migration. [Adding dayjs plugin](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1714400923798239?thread_ts=1714396268.771749&cid=C063Q3F1HPF) seemed to fix this problem.

### How to verify

Using the SDK built before this PR and compare it to the SDK built with this PR. then render the `InteractiveQuestion` to render the line or bar chart. There should be no error with the SDK built with this PR.

### Demo

#### Before
- ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/97f73355-b44c-4774-8e19-f0586c9437ca)
- ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/01d09ef0-27f4-4280-bf66-2f7ff25cf004)


#### After
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/404649ca-6c3b-470a-bb5f-da252b12e80b)


### Checklist

title: Allow multiple values for string operators in the dashboard
body:
This PR is a part of the milestone 2 of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41956.

It expands the multi-select filter capabilities for the dashboard filters to the "contains", "does not contain", "starts with" and "ends with" operators. This behavior was previously possible only for "is" and "is not" operators.

### Testing
- [x] Unit tests partial coverage
- [x] E2E tests (expanded the existing coverage)


Resolves #41956
author: nemanjaglumac

title: Entity picker/new search item component
body:
Part of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39528

### Description

Adds a new search results component that we will use for both recents and search. This implements it in search first so it can get into master while we work on some backend changes for recents.

When picking a collection (new > dashboard)

![Screen Shot 2024-04-30 at 9 25 57 AM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/6b145825-b439-4a4d-b166-3f9b8d49d7d2)

When picking a question (any dashboard > edit > hover a card > replace question)
![Screen Shot 2024-05-02 at 3 40 32 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/aefb5e16-dafd-4967-8e6e-3c0cb52c8b2d)


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Revert "Store fields used in MBQL cards in QueryField (#41821)"
body:
This reverts commit 0da8100558340c745e6dfdc48a11eb48190ca170.

Reverts https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41821

Custom migration was getting field ids from queries. If there were nested mbql queries (`select * from {{#1}}`) it would have to expand those queries in

```clojure
(defn replace-tags
  "Given a native dataset_query, return a `{:query \"<SQL string>\"}` where the SQL no longer has Metabase-specific
  template tags."
  [query]
  (if-let [name->tag (seq (get-in query [:native :template-tags]))]
    ;; this call below requires the app-db to be setup
    (qp.compile/compile (assoc-in query [:native :template-tags] (update-vals name->tag tag-default)))
    (:native query)))
```

And can't do all that while we are migrating the app-db in order to set the app db up.
author: dpsutton
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: React 18
body:
This PR updates the FE to React 18, as well as contains the e2e adjustments to make that work. Some specific changes

- Anything where we expect things to happen while typing (mainly in native query and expression editors where we have dropdowns) has been slowed down (50 ms delay generally). Without this, tests would flake pretty hard in CI
- Login Redirects are now handled by the route guards rather than the login actions. This is because the route guard would kick in before it was actually unmounted on a redirect, always taking you to the homepage
- Rendering the table to measure column widths was updated to support the new `React.createRoot()` way of rendering things
- Table Headers now have their own e2e function for "clicking".  They do not have their own `onClick` handlers but instead look at `dragStart` and `dragEnd` events to decide if you clicked or dragged. The Cypress `.click()` command was not triggering `dragEnd`, so instead we now manually trigger `dragStart` and `dragEnd` on the header to get the popup to show.
- Anything involving dragging (resizing dashcards, re-ordering things etc) has a 200ms delay in between events
- `enterCustomColumnDetails` has an option to not blur after typing. Honestly, I'm not sure how these tests passed before this
- Quite a few places we type something in a box that is actually an `<InputBlueChange /> `and then hit a "Done" button to close a modal or change state, but our value wasn't being saved. This was causing the component to be unmounted before the onBlur handler could fire. Now we explicitly blur the inputs.
- Static Viz has a new dependency for `TextDecoder`, which is used in React 18
- I gave up on trying to type the default tree node in the `<Tree />` component. After upgrading it threw and error and after a few hours of trying to sort it, I slappen an `any` on there üòÆ‚Äçüí®
author: npfitz
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]

title: Move away from deprecated slack upload endpoints
body:
Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41890

This PR changes `metabase.integrations.slack/upload-file!` from using one deprecated endpoint to use the new set of three endpoints (why slack, why?). I used the [python slack SDK](https://github.com/seratch/python-slack-sdk/blob/1d0eed1c73a1ee419561d7924f164f271414679d/slack_sdk/web/async_client.py#L3003) as a reference implementation.

I'm doing this in the laziest simplest way possible, making three requests for each file in series. A simple optimization to follow this up would be to make the first two requests for each file in parallel, and then when all those requests complete call `files.completeUploadExternal` only once for all files. Given this was pretty slow and unoptimized already (we could have been executing requests in parallel before) I'm assuming it's not a huge issue for now, and I've left a TODO in the code explaining this possibility.

This needs manual testing because there's a lot of mocking going on in our automated tests. How to test:
1. Create a slack app following the instructions in Admin > Slack
2. you can use the public channel "cals-slack-integration-test-channel" I've created for testing purposes, or create your own
3. Create a dashboard with a graph in it, or use the example dashboard
4. Create a subscription, pick a user or channel, and click "Send to Slack now".

title: feat(sdk): Add static dashboards to embedding SDK
body: Adds static dashboards to the embedding SDK. These additions are accompanied by small change to the EmbedFrame, in which we pull the location into a new `SyncedEmbedFrame` component which takes the hash options from the URL. The `EmbedFrame` is also changed to accept those hash options as props so we can use them as props for the static dashboard component.

title: Avoid scroll jump
body:
### TL;DR

This pull request addresses a visual issue related to toggling filters by adding a scrolling behavior to the 'BrowseModels' component.

### What changed?

Additional Hooks and Context were introduced to manage the scrollable state of the viewport. The overflowY style attribute of the viewport is saved when the component is rendered and then set to 'scroll'. This style setting is then restored to its original value when the component is unmounted. This stops the page from 'jumping' when filters are toggled.

### How to test?

Navigate to the component and toggle the filters to observe the updated behavior. The page should no longer 'jump' when filters are toggled.

### Why make this change?

The change improves the user experience by reducing visual disruptions that may disorient users while interacting with the component.

title: [QP, lib] Allow multiple arguments to `:contains`, `:starts-with`, etc.
body:
These string matching clauses only allowed two arguments previously.
Typically `[:contains field x]` to match a field against a literal.

This adds similar desugaring for `:contains`, `:does-not-contain`,
`:starts-with` and `:ends-with` that is currently done for
multi-argument `:=` and `:!=`:

```clojure
[:contains field x y z] ;; ->
[:or [:contains field x] [:contains field y] [:contains field z]]

[:does-not-contain field x y z] ;; ->
[:and [:does-not-contain field x]
      [:does-not-contain field y]
      [:does-not-contain field z]]
```
Part of epic #41956.

title: Add null checks to `getCanShowAutoApplyFiltersToast`
body:
"Backports" a tiny refactoring from #37664, adding `dashboard` null checks to the `getCanShowAutoApplyFiltersToast`

Apparently, in v48 it's possible to reach a state where the `dashboard` value is null when opening a dashboard question (more in [this internal thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C505ZNNH4/p1714136446444389))

title: Make `resolve-private-key` include `private-key-options` in database details
body:
Closes #41852

When `hosting` feature is enabled, database edit GUI does not send `private-key-options` as part of request. `secret/get-secrect-string` depends on that value to determine if value should base64 decoded. This PR ensures the value of the key is set correctly in `resolve-private-key`.
author: lbrdnk
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: [Metrics v2] Drop stage metadata after manipulating metric stage
body:
Fixes #41917

We can simply drop `lib/stage-metadata` from a metric stage after dropping the aggregation. Not doing so, made QP assume that the aggregation was the only field in that stage and make an explicit select for it.

title: DB perms page runtime error fix
body:
### Description

When viewing the database permissions page in admin on stats, you'll get a "Something went wrong page". This is due to a race condition of metadata not loading fast enough. I has caught this issue before release for the groups permissions page, but forgot to replicate the fix to the database page

### Checklist

- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
not really needed, these pages should just be ported to Typescript

title: [ECharts] Fix most of failing unit tests
body:
> [!NOTE]
> It should be easier to review the PR by commit. Each commit should be focused on a single spec/test

Fixes the majority of failing unit tests on the `echarts` branch.

There are several specs left where I'm not sure about what to do, I need to double-check the requirements:

1. `AddSeriesModel` ‚Äî one [failing test](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/dd66a69a264c10fe6cadb1860a45a77a1b5061d6/frontend/src/metabase/dashboard/components/AddSeriesModal/AddSeriesModal.unit.spec.tsx#L173) left. Seems to conflict with a recent change to `getLegendItems` function (removing [this condition](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/49d63dccd5485b5fc00af68584471e30ca2ec766/frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/echarts/cartesian/model/legend.ts#L5) makes the test pass)
2. `Funnel` ‚Äî one [failing test](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/dd66a69a264c10fe6cadb1860a45a77a1b5061d6/frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/visualizations/Funnel.unit.spec.jsx#L75) left. After migrating to echarts, [this Funnel codepath](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/49d63dccd5485b5fc00af68584471e30ca2ec766/frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/visualizations/Funnel/Funnel.tsx#L209) no longer renders a title/caption
3. `BarChart` ‚Äî one [failing test](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/11f9028bf0851c0c28d14abd2a2c4533a4218a60/frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/visualizations/BarChart.unit.spec.tsx#L37) left. Not sure why, but [here](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/11f9028bf0851c0c28d14abd2a2c4533a4218a60/frontend/src/metabase/visualizations/lib/settings/graph.js#L446) in `graph.js`, the `series` object has two `data.cols` and one of them is `undefined`, even though we create only one column in the test setup
4. `echarts/cartesian/utils/timeseries` ‚Äî two failing tests left, not sure if I understand the underlying logic good enough to fix this right now, would appreciate some help here
author: kulyk
labels: [('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]

title: Fix SDK style overridden by CSS reset
body:
Fix CSS reset override SDK components

This removes `:where(${baseStyle})` because it doesn't work. We're supposed to add `:where()` to selectors inside `baseStyle` not wrapping all of them inside `:where()` like this. You could see that button doesn't have any inheritance chain from `baseStyle`

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/a536c2d7bf24d111cace04abeedff5f33ac751d5/frontend/src/metabase/css/core/base.styled.ts#L75-L80

#### Master
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/1a5e41e9-fba9-4721-b911-2180c899def8)

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/68de68b4-3075-4716-abf4-91c420687a40)

#### With `:where(${baseStyle})` removed

Searching `:where(` didn't get the same style we got in `master` to confirm it's already removed.

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/75ecc00d-6b45-482d-9b9e-f8af26a2b911)

The style chain looks the same that means it didn't work.

#### Before (screenshot added when the changed line was just `${baseStyle}` instead of `:where(${baseStyle})`
![Screenshot 2024-04-26 at 11 01 15‚ÄØPM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/5cbabc2c-2503-4e23-a647-d2c8894b5d39)


#### After
![Screenshot 2024-04-26 at 10 57 54‚ÄØPM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/f683953d-42bb-401e-9e73-bf460fddc4cd)
author: WiNloSt
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2079687408, 'issue_id': 2266078247, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

Status Complete ‚ÜóÔ∏é
Commit fc36504ddf430424b9ea14b8106b639a0367ce7a
Results
‚ö†Ô∏è 12 Flaky
‚úÖ 2424 Passed
', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 26, 16, 10, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2081998098, 'issue_id': 2266078247, 'author': 'WiNloSt', 'body': "> I added my proposed fix in other PR - https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41860/files#diff-14641f26ed97bb265f70dbec7e345518ff6a3e02cf1d54a86102f41f3a44a189R19 > > I think, it would be slightly better than just removing styles. WDYT? @deniskaber That didn't actually work. `baseStyle` isn't something that could be wrapped in `:where()` alone, we need to apply `:where()` to each selector in `baseStyle` instead. I only [mentioned that on Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C06FCQT0KMZ/p1714147391788559?thread_ts=1714038540.138239&cid=C06FCQT0KMZ). title: Add table view count column and increment it on views
body:
Epic: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38229

Does the same as part 1 and 2 but for tables. Tables was omitted from the original spec, but we decided to include it.
Part 1: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41840
Part 2: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41882

With this PR, we add a new column `metabase_table.view_count` and increment it on a table view, following the same criteria for a view as we do for adding new entries to `view_log`.

title: Increment view_count on card, dashboard, and table views
body:
Epic: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38229
[Technical doc](https://www.notion.so/metabase/e12aa6ef472c4d6ab871f60d1947327b?v=fd15329da9594408807fc38c3a4edb7a&p=086dec987ce84759baca325399c43da5&pm=s)

Previously: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41840

With this PR, we 
1. add a new column metabase_table.view_count and increment it on a table view, following the same criteria for a view as we do for adding new entries to view_log.
2. increment `report_card.view_count`, `report_dashboard.view_count`, and `metabase_table.view_count` if cards, dashboards, and tables are viewed respectively. Before this the column was not being updated at all. 

I've deliberately coupled the code that currently updates `view_log` with the new code that updates the `view_count` column because [we decided](https://www.notion.so/Capture-view-count-for-questions-models-and-dashboards-086dec987ce84759baca325399c43da5?d=0a0a37927f9c400d82fc2253b8a39bf4&pvs=4#37b5b7aee4d14d9d92b3ce012799d96f) to keep these two in sync to avoid confusing discrepancies between them, and lower the risk them getting out of sync in the future.

That means we count:
- public and embedded card/dashboard views, as well as regular views
- if a dashboard is viewed we increment both the dashboard and all the cards in the dashboard
- if a card is pinned to a collection and the collection is viewed, we count a view for the card
author: calherries
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Remove the ace editor gutter line number highlight
body:
This should be pretty non-controversial PR to review.
The design/product team requested we get rid of the annoying gutter line number highlight in the notebook native query preview sidebar.

When I created this component initially, I thought that the prop `highlightActiveLine` set to `false` would be enough, so I couldn't figure out why do we still have this leftover highlight in the gutter. After some digging I found this:
https://ace.c9.io/api/interfaces/ace.Ace.EditorOptions.html#highlightGutterLine

This saved us from having to mess with the CSS overrides üéâ

title: Fix Interactive Question Loading state
body:
### Description

Fixes the problems with the loading state in the SDK Interactive question, which was showing an error before everything was loaded.

_What I did_
* Refactor `initializeQB` to give us more control over error states
* Uses `queryResults` instead of `result` to determine whether the component is loaded, and uses the refactored `initalizeQB` to present an error state if a problem comes up

title: Remove the custom resize handle from the notebook native query preview sidebar
body:
### Description
This PR removes the custom (visible) resize handle that existed on the notebook native query preview sidebar. It resembled a scrollbar too much, which contributed to a confusion when it gets crowded in the UI. The design/product decision was to make the whole left edge of the sidebar resizable, and this PR achieves exactly that.

I've increased the width of the resize handle to 10px to make it easier to find it, and to press it. It is transparent so this really doesn't affect anything visually.

### How to verify
Open a notebook view of any table and open a native query preview on a desktop. You shouldn't see a custom grey resize handle. Clicking anywhere along the left sidebar edge should allow you to resize it.

### Demo
Before
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/78486263-277c-40a1-ab06-0d0f9f846fc4

Now
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/c7d587ce-bf30-45cb-a852-017c12e21d8f

### Checklist
The existing tests should suffice.

title: Mitigate redshift flakes by not dropping view in test
body:
I just came across [this](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8844894760/job/24287698335?pr=41840#step:3:1279) redshift flake. This PR prevents it from happening again.

Similar to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41191

Dropping tables causes flakes in redshift. It's okay to not drop tables anymore in redshift tests with databases created with `with-temp`, because we have fake database isolation using the table name prefix.

title: Fix broken E2E reproduction for #39221
body:
This test has been flaking so badly that it had to be re-run every single time. Sometimes even multiple times in a row.

## Cause
Not sure what exactly changed in the source code that caused this test to fail, but it seems related to the syncing. The original idea was to add a small SQLite database before each test so that each user could pick the database for their respective native queries. That triggers `last-used-native-database-id` user setting update. But the database never appeared in the databases list for the "normal" user. Hence why I think it's a sync problem. The database picker would appear for a few milliseconds, but then the "Sample Database" would get "chosen" automatically as it is the only database available. This caused the re-render (which is why Cypress failed) 

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/bf3a5317-f2e9-407c-b2d4-912d900dcadc)

## Solution
I've simplified the test by skipping the "add new database" and simply used another action that also triggers user-local setting update (this time it's `notebook-native-preview-shown`). We really only needed ANY action that updates the local setting in order to see which requests fire after it.

Local run
![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/9a11f466-6527-499c-b2fa-e507c11c456a)

The stress-test run x 20 ‚úÖ 
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8845783621

title: Experiment: theming for React embedding SDK
author: heypoom

title: Fix format-rfc3339 uses 12 hour format
body:
Fix the bug that the `format-rfc3339` function used the 12-hour format instead of 24-hour.

It was used only to format the `instance-creation` time for snowplow events, and those timestamps will definitely be off :(.
The silver lining is that the data will get corrected once this fix is shipped and instances start to resend snowplow events.

Lucky for us, it doesn't affect the event time (aka root timestamp on snowplow) because it's created during the snowplow's ingestion.
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Fix Snowflake/Redshift filtering on date for timestamp with time zone columns
body:
Fixes #8804
Fixes #11643
Fixes #19910
Fixes #39769
Fixes #41863
Fixes #41866
Fixes #42073

The Snowflake JDBC driver still doesn't support Java 8 `java.time` classes, which means we were setting things like `OffsetDateTime` as a `java.sql.Timestamp`... even worse, it ignores attached `java.util.Calendar`s (`java.sql.Timestamp` + `java.util.Calendar` is basically the pre-Java-8 way of setting a `timestamp with time zone` value in JDBC)... we actually had code to do the right thing for Snowflake from #11718 but it only worked for `ZonedDateTime`:

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/b93e99d/modules/drivers/snowflake/src/metabase/driver/snowflake.clj?rgh-link-date=2024-04-25T21%3A33%3A43Z#L618-L632

In #40530 I fixed related issues for `date = date` filtering but there were still issues with `timestamp_tz = date` filtering. 

I ended up changing the Snowflake QP code to just output timestamp literals directly, e.g. 

```sql
'2024-04-25 17:58:00 -07:00'::timestamp_tz
```

instead of 

```sql
? -- a java.sql.Timestamp 
```

so we can be sure it's doing the right thing and so we're no longer at the mercy of a poorly-implemented JDBC driver.

I had to fix some stuff with native query parameter compilation, for whatever reason it wasn't calling `->honeysql` for `java.time` classes and just assuming everyone wanted `?`; now it's working correctly.
author: camsaul
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

This introduces a linter against importing a module's internals from outside that module.

Uses `metabase.upload` and `metabase.db` as test cases, which motivate the need to supporting nested and internal modules.

title: Add Reset button for InteractiveQuestion
body: Relates to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41095 ### Description This adds reset button for InteractiveQuestion. Design - https://www.figma.com/file/IeFkhQfxKXmy4xjnQLKV5k/SDK-interactive-question-reset-button?node-id=7422%3A13587 Also this adds optional title for InteractiveQuestion so that reset button looks not that bad. And possibility to pass a custom title. ### How to verify Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected. 1. Build sdk, then test with the latest demo. 2. `withResetButton={false}` on InteractiveQuestion should remove this button 3. `withTitle={true}` should enable default question title ### Demo ### Checklist - [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix MLv2 native query schema
body: Native queries can have `:params`, not `:args`, and these are allowed to be a sequence of anything, or `:params` can be `nil`. AFAIK this didn't affect anything but for reference purposes we should fix the schema.
author: camsaul
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]
