title: fix type error in NativeQueryEditor
body:
### Description

The type check CI check was still failing on https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41395 due to a type error in `NativeQueryEditor`. This PR fixes that type error.

### How to verify

CI + `yarn type-check`

```
$ tsc --noEmit
‚ú®  Done in 37.27s.
```

No remaining type errors.

### Demo

![Screenshot 2024-04-25 at 1.59.33 PM.png](https://graphite-user-uploaded-assets-prod.s3.amazonaws.com/9ULpbAzGBtvQRyZEpGvu/a3a4da4c-d4b4-4fb7-9ca9-0da8925e0b75.png)

body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41536

### Description
Small PR to prioritize recent items in command palette, and to have search results mirror API response

### How to verify

1. Open the command palette -> You should see recent items above actions now
2. Go to the search page and type a query, then open the command palette and type the same query
3. results should match.

title: Remove Recents Entity
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41844

Preliminary work for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39528

### Description

Removes the recent items entity, and updates the places in the app where it was used. 



.|.
---|---
command palette | ![Screen Shot 2024-04-25 at 1 48 10 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/fa94e9d8-c610-42a8-bf29-9b31fc713d81)
search suggestions | ![Screen Shot 2024-04-25 at 1 47 47 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/aefa78f4-426f-4fa6-93f1-5d2affc5d48b)
homepage | ![Screen Shot 2024-04-25 at 1 47 39 PM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/30528226/ff9aefba-0de9-4229-831b-65d6b4440fda)

Also required the creation of two utilities that the entity previously had, but I think we can use widely throughout the app:

- `getIcon` 
- `getName`

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Add view_count for cards and dashboards and populate it from view_log
body:
Epic: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38229
[Technical doc](https://www.notion.so/metabase/e12aa6ef472c4d6ab871f60d1947327b?v=fd15329da9594408807fc38c3a4edb7a&p=086dec987ce84759baca325399c43da5&pm=s)

This is the first PR of two for Milestone 4 in the epic. It adds a new column `view_count` to `report_card` and `report_dashboard`. The columns are not included in revision history objects, but they are serialized in serialization. 

A PR following this one will modify `:event/card-read` and `:event/dashboard-read` event handlers to increment the column when a user views the card or dashboard.

The use case for Milestone 4 is TBD, but most likely this would be shown in collections to help users find relevant content or help rank search results.

title: Add a note about perms graph changes to the API changelog
body:
Adds a note that the keys in the permissions graph are changing in v50. 

I could add a lot more detail here, like how the new permissions are different from the old ones and what the valid permission values are, but I'm not sure if it's worth it. I figured we can keep the API changelog concise so it's easy to skim, and folks can refer to the docs for more details about the product change if they need it.

title: fix Funnel type error
body:
### Description

Fixes type errors for the Funnel chart. We do this largely by deleting the `LegendHeader` component, which was a dead codepath previously used to handle dashcard actions, which are now done in `DashCardActionsPanel`. See https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/36745, a similar PR that removes the majority of useful props from `LegendHeader`.

### How to verify

CI + `yarn type-check`

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/37751258/43e54164-2e63-4d7b-b1be-53610ecc0d4f

Note: there is a bug that surfaces in this recording where the settings do not update on the funnel bar, but that's a separate issue (may not even be a regression).

title: Fix histogram x axis ticks
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41148

### Description

Fixes histogram ticks when rotation to 45 or 90 degrees is enabled. Auto-rotation also works now.

After the rebase on top of the master storybook stories font has changed but it is not related to this PR..

### How to verify

- New -> Orders by Total: 10 buckets
- Ensure ticks are horizontal
- Change to 50 buckets
- Ensure ticks are rotated to 45 degrees
- Change to 100 buckets
- Ensure ticks are rotated to 90 degrees

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/14301985/3e215101-f056-466c-949e-2a88b759d67c

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Re-wire the `Collections` entity to use RTK Query under the hood
body:
Resolves https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41818, and with it https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40806 because `SnippetCollections` entity is really only reusing the "regular" `Collections` entity under the hood.

This PR (together with the #41992) resolves the milestone one of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40788
author: nemanjaglumac

title: Bump mysql2 from 3.9.4 to 3.9.7
body:
Bumps [mysql2](https://github.com/sidorares/node-mysql2) from 3.9.4 to 3.9.7.
Release notes

Sourced from mysql2's releases.

v3.9.7

3.9.7 (2024-04-21)

Bug Fixes

  • security: sanitize timezone parameter value to prevent code injection - report by zhaoyudi (Nebulalab) (#2608) (7d4b098)

v3.9.6

3.9.6 (2024-04-18)

Bug Fixes

  • binary parser sometimes reads out of packet bounds when results contain null and typecast is false (#2601) (705835d)

v3.9.5

3.9.5 (2024-04-17)

Bug Fixes

  • revert breaking change in results creation (#2591) (f7c60d0)
Changelog

Sourced from mysql2's changelog.

3.9.7 (2024-04-21)

Bug Fixes

  • security: sanitize timezone parameter value to prevent code injection (#2608) (7d4b098)

3.9.6 (2024-04-18)

Bug Fixes

  • binary parser sometimes reads out of packet bounds when results contain null and typecast is false (#2601) (705835d)

3.9.5 (2024-04-17)

Bug Fixes

  • revert breaking change in results creation (#2591) (f7c60d0)

  • 705835d fix: binary parser sometimes reads out of packet bounds when results contain ...
  • 2129818 chore(master): release 3.9.5 (#2600)

  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Add entity_id columns to users and groups
body:
Pursuant to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38621
* Adds `entity_id` to users and permission groups
* Adds the `entity_id` toucan hook to the respective models

I'm _not_ backfilling entity IDs in a migration, per [discussion on Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C064EB1UE5P/p1713896559364009). Instead we'll backfill IDs the first time that SCIM is configured.

title: docs -  generate environment variables
body:
- Generates environment variable docs from `defsettings`, omitting setterless settings and settings local to users and databases.
- Tacks on existing env var docs for non-`defsetting` env vars.

## Notes

### The other-env-vars doc is a hack

Due to nontrivial (read "expensive") reasons involving circular dependencies, some of the older environment variable settings aren't rendered as `defsettings`. See https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/26911. So this PR just sticks those vars on at the end by reading in existing markdown docs for them. A next step here to is to codify this markdown in some data format and then interpolate it into the `defsetting` variables, but figured we should get this over the line first.

### To backport this PR, the generated environment variables will be removed before merging

I've included the updated environment variables docs for viewing only. Before merging this PR, I'll restore the original environment-variables.md file so that we can backport the changes to the current release branch. From there, I'll put up additional PRs that use this script to update the environment variables docs for both master and release branches.

### At least two `defsetting` defaults are set elsewhere

Some `defsetting`s have their default value sets elsewhere. For example: `aggregated-query-row-limit`.

Defined here:

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/c3c7f52cfd100056843aea5ee43225a42fc0218c/src/metabase/query_processor/middleware/constraints.clj#L38

Default set here:

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/c3c7f52cfd100056843aea5ee43225a42fc0218c/src/metabase/query_processor/middleware/constraints.clj#L25

I have some code to handle this, but there's no easy way to go through all the defsettings and find whether their defaults are set elsewhere. We can probably address these as they come up.

## Next steps

Once this code is in place, we can extend it to generate an example config file with defaults for people to copy. And then maybe start organizing env vars into groups.
author: jeff-bruemmer
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]

title: Remove Dead Pickers
body:

Some cleanup to remove the now defunct unused pickers.

- updated LinkedEntityPicker to use the dashboard or question picker modals
- updated the timeline move modal to use the collection picker 
- deleted the old ItemPicker, and all the things that used it ü•≥
- removed the createCollectionOnTheGo hoc, that is no longer used due to the entity picker making this so much nicer


### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Fix Cloverage failures on master
body:
Fix Cloverage failures on master which were inadvertently introduced by https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41697.

The `audit-installed?` atom wasn't being reset between tests. So if one test installed audit content while using a temporary app DB, `audit-installed?` would still be `true` after the app DB got swapped out. Because `default-audit-collection` is memoized based on `audit-installed?`, subsequent tests would see the wrong memoized value, causing test failures.

I've fixed this by getting rid of the `audit-installed?` atom and using the checksum of the audit content for the memoization instead.
author: noahmoss
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team'), ('run-cloverage', 'Runs Cloverage (BE test coverage job) on this PR')]

title: Fix cumulative aggregations in queries with filters and breakouts
body:
In `master` we started splitting stages with cumulative aggregations and breakouts into two stages so things work correctly for fussy databases that don't like any kind of complicated expressions in window function `OVER` clauses... there was a bug in this logic and it  didn't handle `:filters` properly. Relatively easy fix

Fixes #41791

title: Remove SDK API keys from existence
body:
We won't be using API keys for the SDK, so we're removing any logic related to them in the SDK.

Besides removing some code, I modified the `use-init-data` test to use `isValidUser` and `isValidConfig` to test which login states should be triggered.

title: Enable customization of columns in ItemsTable
body:
Lets the `ItemsTable` component have customizable columns.

The logic for this is contained in `BaseItemsTable`. This is preliminary work for #41614

This doesn't introduce any new UI, but there is a unit test for the new logic.

The main thing to check is whether the table on the collections page stills work correctly. Note how the columns adjust as you resize the viewport horizontally. (In fact, the columns will sometimes adjust as you close and open the sidebar, because the width they are paying attention to is the width of the area to the right of the sidebar.)

Closes #41908
author: rafpaf
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Add Embedding SDK readme
body:
This PR adds the embedding SDK for React README.md which contains a short instruction how to use our SDK.

This is the readme outline
- How to install the SDK
- How to configure it (`config`)
- How to use it e.g. `InteractiveQuestion`
- How to use the plugins
- How to configure the JWT endpoint
- Examples: Now it only links to [customer-zero](https://github.com/metabase/embedding-sdk-customer-zero). Which I just realize that it's private. Maybe we can remove this section.
- SDK limitation

title: Send pulses in parallel
body:
Milestone 1 of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41764 (except "Prioritize fast pulses")

Background: Currently, we have a SendPulses job that runs hourly. It finds all Pulses scheduled to run at that hour and sends each of them sequentially.

In this PR, I've changed it so that pulses are executed in parallel by creating a trigger for each group of channels that are scheduled to run at the same time.

That might be confusing, so here is an example:
- you have an alert that is scheduled to send email **and** to a slack channel at 6 am. In this case, we'll create one trigger that sends that pulse to both channels. This allows us to save some computation of executing the card.
- You have an alert and configured to send to slack channel at 6am, but to send an email at 8am, in this case we'll create 2 trigger, one for each timestamp. (well you can't really do this in the UI right now but in theory, you can)

After this I'll create a follow up PR to prioritize fast pulses to be sent first in case of reaching our thread hold of maximum parallel jobs for Quartz

Tech doc: https://www.notion.so/metabase/Improve-Pulse-performance-and-debuggability-caa4921e7376452f8c721d30eb3a7bb9?pvs=4
author: qnkhuat
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2076461254, 'issue_id': 2261206554, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

Status Complete ‚ÜóÔ∏é
Commit 0172112cbeb61f13b7ac1ead4143908ce33aca61
Results
‚ö†Ô∏è 10 Flaky
‚úÖ 2461 Passed
', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 25, 6, 28, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2088110059, 'issue_id': 2261206554, 'author': 'tsmacdonald', 'body': 'Needs a rebase :(', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 1, 7, 51, 25, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2092294897, 'issue_id': 2261206554, 'author': 'qnkhuat', 'body': "> 1. RePrioritizeSendPulses seems unnecessary there are a couple of points here: 1. whether prioritizing fast pulses is necessary looking at this [question](https://stats.metabase.com/question#) it suggests that there are customers who have a lot of pulses scheduled to be executed at the same time, for those cases prioritizing fast pulses look like a good thing to have. 2. there are opportunities to make sending pulse faster I agree, and I think we'll get there. But the 2 ideas are mutually exclusive 3. Clearing PulseChannels that have no recipients yea it's used to power the undo feature. I guess we could rework it to the model hooks, but I think it's out of the scope of this PR and not sure how much value we gain there. > 2. The data model is looser than the code Agree that a refactor is needed. there is a lot of strangeness between alert and dashboard subscription. But that's out of the scope of this PR. We could discuss more about refactoring in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/17871.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 3, 5, 22, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2092482911, 'issue_id': 2261206554, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': "1. whether prioritizing fast pulses is necessary Okay fair, it's a fine idea and prioritizing faster pulses could have some benefit. And if it can be implemented cheaply then it's a no brainer. My main concern is that the docstring and name of this job is misleading, because `RePrioritizeSendPulses` doesn't actually reprioritize any send pulses right now while its unimplemented, and it's not clear that a periodic job is the best way to prioritize pulses. For example since we're using quartz, we can implement this by assigning a priority to a trigger. Priority values can be set in a way that prioritizes fast pulses over slower ones. That doesn't have to be done in a periodic job, separate from the execution of a pulse. The priority for each job can be reset at the end of the job's own execution. Also, I think you missed addressing this point I made about `RePrioritizeSendPulses`: > ... But what it actually does is group job+triggers that have the same pulse ID and schedule. But that seems like it can be done in update-send-pulse-trigger-if-needed! anyway, because we have the context we need there to use the same trigger for both channels. 2. Clearing PulseChannels that have no recipients. Here's a suggestion: rather than putting it on the model hooks, why not make it part of the send-pulse job? Even if we don't want to rework it as part of this PR, maybe leave a TODO to explain that it's possible, because in the future we could remove that job. Also, you should add back [the comment](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41772/files#diff-f4f3701046f83250b808885d1d156277f39db1d2e1ae081499c1445277c33644L62) that you deleted explaining why it needs to be done asynchronously. I think it was dropped by mistake.", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 3, 7, 46, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2096563853, 'issue_id': 2261206554, 'author': 'qnkhuat', 'body': "@calherries good point. it'll be an easy fix tho, we just need to make sure archive/unarchiving dashboard will also update pulse.archived", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 6, 17, 34, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2096566569, 'issue_id': 2261206554, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': 'yes, and a migration to clean up the existing ones, and delete their triggers', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 6, 17, 36, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2097634828, 'issue_id': 2261206554, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '@qnkhuat Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 5, 7, 7, 30, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2100263983, 'issue_id': 2261206554, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': '@qnkhuat I just discovered a pretty serious issue with this. After this PR, existing pulses will cease to work if you upgrade an instance from 49 to 50, then rollback from 50 to 49, then upgrade from 49 to 50. I think the issue can be fixed if you remove the `metabase.task.send-pulses.send-pulse.job` triggers on rollback. Reasoning follows: After rolling back an instance from 50 to 49, initializing Metabase gives me this error: ``` 2024-05-08 10:00:05,528 ERROR jdbcjobstore.JobStoreTX :: Error retrieving job, setting trigger state to ERROR. org.quartz.JobPersistenceException: Couldn't retrieve job because a required class was not found: metabase.task.send_pulses.SendPulse [See nested exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: metabase.task.send_pulses.SendPulse] at org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreSupport.retrieveJob(JobStoreSupport.java:1393) at With one pulse trigger set up, I get this: ``` # select trigger_state from qrtz_triggers where job_name = 'metabase.task.send-pulses.send-pulse.job'; trigger_state --------------- ERROR ``` Everything else looks fine, so the only consequence of this while on 49, is a confusing error message for the person starting up the instance. The bigger problem is what happens when you upgrade to 50. The `trigger_state` for send pulse triggers will still be `ERROR` after upgrading. That means that it won't be fired again unless the trigger is rescheduled from the UI. From the [docs](https://www.quartz-scheduler.org/api/1.8.6/org/quartz/Trigger.html#STATE_ERROR): > When the trigger is in the error state, the scheduler will make no attempts to fire it. tsmacdonald on (2024-05-01 07:51:25 UTC): Needs a rebase :( qnkhuat (Issue Creator) on (2024-05-03 05:22:06 UTC): there are a couple of points here: 1. whether prioritizing fast pulses is necessary looking at this [question](https://stats.metabase.com/question#) it suggests that there are customers who have a lot of pulses scheduled to be executed at the same time, for those cases prioritizing fast pulses look like a good thing to have. 2. there are opportunities to make sending pulse faster I agree, and I think we'll get there. But the 2 ideas are mutually exclusive 3. Clearing PulseChannels that have no recipients yea it's used to power the undo feature. I guess we could rework it to the model hooks, but I think it's out of the scope of this PR and not sure how much value we gain there. Agree that a refactor is needed. there is a lot of strangeness between alert and dashboard subscription. But that's out of the scope of this PR. We could discuss more about refactoring in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/17871. calherries on (2024-05-03 07:46:22 UTC): 1. whether prioritizing fast pulses is necessary Okay fair, it's a fine idea and prioritizing faster pulses could have some benefit. And if it can be implemented cheaply then it's a no brainer. My main concern is that the docstring and name of this job is misleading, because `RePrioritizeSendPulses` doesn't actually reprioritize any send pulses right now while its unimplemented, and it's not clear that a periodic job is the best way to prioritize pulses. For example since we're using quartz, we can implement this by assigning a priority to a trigger. Priority values can be set in a way that prioritizes fast pulses over slower ones. That doesn't have to be done in a periodic job, separate from the execution of a pulse. The priority for each job can be reset at the end of the job's own execution. Also, I think you missed addressing this point I made about `RePrioritizeSendPulses`: 2. Clearing PulseChannels that have no recipients. Here's a suggestion: rather than putting it on the model hooks, why not make it part of the send-pulse job? Even if we don't want to rework it as part of this PR, maybe leave a TODO to explain that it's possible, because in the future we could remove that job. Also, you should add back [the comment](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41772/files#diff-f4f3701046f83250b808885d1d156277f39db1d2e1ae081499c1445277c33644L62) that you deleted explaining why it needs to be done asynchronously. I think it was dropped by mistake. qnkhuat (Issue Creator) on (2024-05-06 17:34:23 UTC): @calherries good point. it'll be an easy fix tho, we just need to make sure archive/unarchiving dashboard will also update pulse.archived calherries on (2024-05-06 17:36:02 UTC): yes, and a migration to clean up the existing ones, and delete their triggers github-actions[bot] on (2024-05-07 07:30:13 UTC): @qnkhuat Did you forget to add a milestone to the issue for this PR? _[When and where should I add a milestone?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#3dea255ffa3b4f74942a227844e889fa)_ calherries on (2024-05-08 10:28:43 UTC): @qnkhuat I just discovered a pretty serious issue with this. After this PR, existing pulses will cease to work if you upgrade an instance from 49 to 50, then rollback from 50 to 49, then upgrade from 49 to 50. I think the issue can be fixed if you remove the `metabase.task.send-pulses.send-pulse.job` triggers on rollback. Reasoning follows: After rolling back an instance from 50 to 49, initializing Metabase gives me this error: ``` 2024-05-08 10:00:05,528 ERROR jdbcjobstore.JobStoreTX :: Error retrieving job, setting trigger state to ERROR. org.quartz.JobPersistenceException: Couldn't retrieve job because a required class was not found: metabase.task.send_pulses.SendPulse [See nested exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: metabase.task.send_pulses.SendPulse] at org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreSupport.retrieveJob(JobStoreSupport.java:1393) at org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreSupport.acquireNextTrigger(JobStoreSupport.java:2864) at org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreSupport$41.execute(JobStoreSupport.java:2805) at org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreSupport$41.execute(JobStoreSupport.java:2803) at org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreSupport.executeInNonManagedTXLock(JobStoreSupport.java:3864) at org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreSupport.acquireNextTriggers(JobStoreSupport.java:2802) at org.quartz.core.QuartzSchedulerThread.run(QuartzSchedulerThread.java:287) Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: metabase.task.send_pulses.SendPulse at java.base/java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:476) at clojure.lang.DynamicClassLoader.findClass(DynamicClassLoader.java:69) at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:589) at clojure.lang.DynamicClassLoader.loadClass(DynamicClassLoader.java:77) at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:522) at java.base/java.lang.Class.forName0(Native Method) at java.base/java.lang.Class.forName(Class.java:398) at metabase.task$load_class.invokeStatic(task.clj:117) at metabase.task$load_class.invoke(task.clj:116) at metabase.task.ClassLoadHelper.loadClass(task.clj:127) at org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.StdJDBCDelegate.selectJobDetail(StdJDBCDelegate.java:852) at org.quartz.impl.jdbcjobstore.JobStoreSupport.retrieveJob(JobStoreSupport.java:1390) ``` At that stage every trigger's `trigger_state` is set to "ERROR" for the send-pulse job. With one pulse trigger set up, I get this: ``` # select trigger_state from qrtz_triggers where job_name = 'metabase.task.send-pulses.send-pulse.job'; trigger_state --------------- ERROR ``` Everything else looks fine, so the only consequence of this while on 49, is a confusing error message for the person starting up the instance. The bigger problem is what happens when you upgrade to 50. The `trigger_state` for send pulse triggers will still be `ERROR` after upgrading. That means that it won't be fired again unless the trigger is rescheduled from the UI. From the [docs](https://www.quartz-scheduler.org/api/1.8.6/org/quartz/Trigger.html#STATE_ERROR): So all the pulses that existed before the initial upgrade from 49 to 50 will fail to trigger again until they are rescheduled from the UI. qnkhuat (Issue Creator) on (2024-05-08 10:34:04 UTC): nice catch! I was thinking about making quartz auto-delete triggers that don't have a job class. It'll help fix this issue and we also don't have to remove jobs using custom migration going forward.

title: Add analytics event for combining/extracting columns
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41766

[Diffs for the schema change](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/compare/37474ff170d29d33f26d166b52327443377558c2..a8860f188b7f77b1baa21eefb108a888f0350007#diff-64d1eaece53349310a4aebe48ef3b84eca57a5c4f96b265daabda6aee08ffaef)

### Description

Adds an analytics events that fires when the custom expression for combining or extracting columns is inserted via the notebook shortcut, or via the chill mode column header.

- `column_combine_via_shortcut`
- `column_combine_via_column_header`
- `column_extract_via_shortcut`
- `column_extract_via_column_header`


Adds an new property `custom_expressions_used` to track the expressions used.

I chose to add all of these at once here to avoid having to create new schema versions in 4 PR's.
author: romeovs
labels: [('.Frontend', ''), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: focus on y-axis of hovered series
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41217

### Description

When a chart has two y-axis and a series is hovered, we need to hide the axis that the series is not measured against.

### How to verify

- Create a chart with two Y-axes
- Hover series that belong to the left axis: ensure the right axis is hidden
- Hover series that belong to the right axis: ensure the left axis is hidden

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/14301985/16d5b3d0-813c-429e-85a0-e1a898f17b8b
author: alxnddr

title: Fix flaky perms EE to OSS downgrade test
body:
### Description

Fixes a race condition where the token reset doesn't always happen fast enough before the test continues. Can be seen here (you'll noticed the HTTP request for sending the token change never goes out in this case as the page reloads before it does):
https://app.replay.io/recording/e2etestscenariospermissionsdowngrade-ee-to-osscyspecjs--114062e6-4299-4b82-89b7-32fe0854186b?commentId=&focusWindow=eyJiZWdpbiI6eyJwb2ludCI6IjYxNjU4NTI1MjQxMDYyNTE2MzgzODAxOTg3NzI5MjAzMjczIiwidGltZSI6MzQ2ODh9LCJlbmQiOnsicG9pbnQiOiI5NzAzMTA0NzY0MTIxMzQ1NTIzNzIwNTAzNDE3ODQ2MTI2NSIsInRpbWUiOjQ4NjQ5fX0%253D&point=80805119950263979432096870994818389&primaryPanel=cypress&secondaryPanel=console&time=42918&viewMode=dev

### How to verify

I've successfully run a stress test on the problematic tests here:
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/8807297112/job/24174031413

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: allow scientific notation (`e`) in `ChartSettingInputNumeric.tsx`
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/29974

Slack thread: https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C01LQQ2UW03/p1713865041378179

### Description

In https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/33056 we inadvertently removed support for scientific notation in viz settings. This PR restores the functionality.

### How to verify

1. Create a new question with a line chart (e.g. count of orders group by created at: month)
2. Go to series settings for the y-axis series, input a number with scientific notation for the multiplier setting
3. Confirm it works

### Demo

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/37751258/bf0ed24d-f06a-4b27-a952-ed4226b44a2c

Accepts valid inputs

https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/37751258/a0fe4a96-a5b3-42a9-911e-13483ade6b40

Rejects invalid inputs

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Test for sample database having sync scheduled
body:
Follow-up to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40066

This PR adds a test for the sample database getting its sync scheduled as if it were a normal database that was added after the initial metabase setup.

Previously this didn't really need test coverage because the sample database was being inserted using `t2/insert!`, and the sync tasks were scheduled in the `after-insert` hooks. Now we're inserting the sample database in a migration without using `t2/insert!`, we should test this specifically. The jobs are being scheduled because we're using `t2/update!` to update the sample database details outside of the migration, but that seems like a pretty shaky guarantee and could be changed in the future, so this PR adds the test coverage.

title: Avoid adding home column part to aliases in specific joins
body:
Closes #40477

This PR changes how alias is generated. In case there are more than one foreign key columns in the joining query with target of a joined field, that is used in the condition rhs, home field part of the alias string is left out.

Reason being, that if the lhs is changed later, alias still corresponds to the new reality.

title: Track public and embedded card views, and collection views in the view log
body:
This PR fills in the gaps where we were tracking some views of entities and not others in the view log. The goal is to enable implementing [auto cleanup collections](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Auto-cleanup-collections-54b3b58e254a48e69b26a054c84fd944), an up-coming EE feature.

It is part of milestone 3 of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38229

After this PR, these are the endpoints through which we track view log events for:

dashboards:
- `GET /api/dashboard/:id`
- `GET /api/public/dashboard/:uuid`
- `GET /api/embed/dashboard/:uuid`

cards:
- `GET /api/card/:id`
- `GET /api/public/card/:uuid` (new)
- `GET /api/embed/card/:uuid` (new)

collections:
- `GET /api/collection/:id/items` (new)

### Tests

I've put all the tests for the view log in one namespace, `metabase.events.view-log-test`. Previously they were all spread out over the api namespaces. Having them all in one namespace makes it much easier to check what endpoints create view log records.
author: calherries
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Add `collection.effective_ancestors` to model search results
body:
fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41909

The ultimate goal here is to be able to display a UI like so:

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/2152134/2f2658d3-2ac5-412e-b79c-951103cd6552)

To do this, we want the frontend to have access to the effective ancestors of model search results.

This was a bit more painful than I'd hoped. The primary issue was that we tied two things together:

- scoring results

- "serializing" results (really, partially serializing results, because we do more work to shape the data later)

Why is this a problem? The `top-scorers` function took a transducer and returned the *serialized* top scorers. Later, when we need to operate on *all* the top results (in this case, to collect all the collection IDs and names that we know of), we're looking at the serialized results.

In our case, we needed some data (collection location) that wasn't included after serialization. We could add it, of course, but it's frustrating to need to change the API of what data is *returned* from the endpoint for purely internal purposes (changing the data available during *processing*).

I ended up pulling serialization out of the scoring function. At some point down the road, we should go ahead and move the `serialize` function out of the `search.scoring` namespace entirely - there's really no reason for it to belong there as far as I can tell.
author: johnswanson
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: Questions Automatically Set as Scalar can be unset to other displays
body:
Fixes: #40623

In the case where a result passes the check for a scalar display (1 row and 1 column), the display is set. Then, upon subsequent calls to the same part of the code, the condition always just returns this.display. Since it was set as scalar previously, it'll always be scalar, even when a new display (eg. table) should be used instead.

This fixes that problem by using this.setDefaultDpslay(); to set the display.
author: adam-james-v

title: Druid jdbc dataset unification
body:
This PR contains:
1. WIP Druid JDBC driver, but more importantly,
2. WIP changes necessary for runtime data ingestion.

It should serve as reference in case I'll be implementing runtime ingestion sometime in future. At the moment there are lot of small problems, hence pausing the work in favor of duplication of some test in the `druid-jdbc` driver branch.

Notable changes, necesasry for runtime ingestion to work:
- Ingestion functionality (`modules/drivers/druid-jdbc/test/metabase/test/data/druid_jdbc/ingestion.clj`).
- Dataset preprocessing to overcome Druid JDBC limitations (no secondary timestamps, odrer bys only by __time column in select queries...).
- test functions to handle mapping of dataset table name to database namespaced Druid table name.
- etc.
author: lbrdnk

title: tabbing through save question modal
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41683

### Description
Fixing tabbing in the save question modal. This was broken because the Mantine modal component was wrapped in our own modal component, and both components were trying to trap focus. I added a quick assertion to an existing e2e test to protect against regressions.

### How to verify

1. New question -> Sample Dataset -> Orders
2. click save
3. attempt to tab through the form in the modal

### Demo
![chrome_vZoXHX0l7o](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1328979/02e53127-5dfc-4a1a-9eb6-830a30351470)

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Export input wrapper and remove label hack
body:
This PR proposes to remove the `&:not(:only-child)` wrapper hack from our input components 

- TextInput
- TextArea
- Select
- FileInput
- DateInput
- TimeInput

All these components share an underlying component: `Input`, and it makes more sense to implement it there.

The components share this basic structure:
```
<Input.Wrapper>
  {label && <label>{label}</label>}
  <{actual input control} />
</Input.Wrapper>
```

This makes use of the observation that `&:not(:only-child)` is functionally equivalent to the `label` component being rendered. Therefore makes more sense to add a bottom margin to the `label` component than it is to add a top margin to the input when the label is rendered.

This is easier to reason about and potentially override.
author: romeovs
labels: [('.Frontend', ''), ('visual', 'Run Percy visual testing'), ('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

I added temp utm tags, there's a discussion about how to structure them consistently in the app but for now we're using the ones in this PR: [slack thread](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1713893576320249?thread_ts=1713357720.005299&cid=C063Q3F1HPF)

This PR contains:

- one change to the event dispatched when we publish a dashboard, I added a field to check if it's the example dashboard. We need the info for the funnel of the embedding homepage to see if they actually did followed it

title: Fix missing permissions for sample DB
body: Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41701 ### Explanation of the bug After https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40066, the sample database wasn't getting the permissions added that it did previously. Previously the sample database was created with `t2/insert!`, and the after-insert hook would create `data_permissions` rows for it. After https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40066 the sample database was created by inserting rows into the database, so there were no post-insert hooks. We don't use `t2/insert!` anymore because it's in a migration and migrations can't depend on toucan model code. ### The fix We now insert the `data_permissions` rows with the sample database, as if it were inserted with `t2/insert` as before. The sample database now has the right permissions on starting a metabase instance for the first time:
author: calherries
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]

title: Fix TippyPopover default text color not visible after migration
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41688
Relate to Epic https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/38811

### Description
This is how it looks after the migration, when [`color: (--non-existing-var)` was removed](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/commit/855b32452bb9fbcb800002f57fe11b4a8e31b048#diff-80e9da3c53d203b191b76db172e9c778cf38d00390b6b731c488d9523b21fc2dL56)
![Screenshot 2024-04-23 at 1 52 48‚ÄØPM](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/d4f21cf1-24ea-4458-a414-9862280419c0)

The color will be from `.tippy-box` rule instead.

The problem was from the way how default `color` is determined on Tippy popover. We previously used `color: var(--color-text-default)` but this custom property doesn't exist. What it actually does is overriding `color` from `.tippy-box` instead and since the CSS custom property doesn't exist, it ends up inheriting the color from `body`.

So to fix this I override `.tippy-box` color to be `color: inherit`, so it will use color from the root node style instead which is exactly the same way when we use `color: var(--this-var-do-not-exist)` before.

### How to verify

Check any popover and use TippyPopover under the hood e.g.
- Table viz column formatting
    ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/f80655bf-575f-4d58-9618-61093fa7632f)

- Notebook editor > custom column > function helper popover
    ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/357dd6cc-abc2-4cf7-b102-63bca86afc9b)

- When adding a new user to a group > type something to show the autocompletion popover
    ![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/1937582/2e4b6d1a-2a4f-4b90-b056-b6adb4b4a674)

### Checklist

- [ ] ~Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR~ Only style change
author: WiNloSt
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Use proper case for year date format
body:
Fixes #40493

### Description

This PR fixes a regression caused by improper year token formatting in momentJS. It is a bit silly, but if we look at [the documentation](https://momentjs.com/docs/#/parsing/string-format/), it shows that year must be represented with all caps `YYYY` token. It also says that "Tokens are case-sensitive." 

### How to verify

Follow the repro steps from the original issue.

### Demo
https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/31325167/8ef769d9-03d6-46f6-b0d4-e004d69b9597

```

2. with the fix

```

title: fix invalid series names in tooltip
body:
### Description

Fixes invalid tooltip series names. Previously we used series name for columns that are used by the series in tooltips. However, series names (what we show in legends) may differ from what we need to show in tooltips:

Here is a break down of what we need to show when cards are combined.
**For a single metric card**
Series name: `card name`
Tooltip name: `column name`
When series name is overriden in settings both series name and tooltip name should use the specified value.

**For a multiple metric card**
Series name: `card name: column name`
Tooltip name: `column name`
When series name is overriden in settings both series name and tooltip name should use the specified value.

**For a breakout card**
Series name: `card name: breakout value`
Tooltip name: `column name`
When series name is overriden in settings both series name and tooltip name should use the specified value.

### How to verify

Verify cases above and/or ensure `e2e/test/scenarios/visualizations-charts/line-bar-tooltips.cy.spec.js` and `e2e/test/scenarios/visualizations-charts/line_chart.cy.spec.js` are green

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41290 ### Description When multiple cards (datasets) are combined on a single dashboard card the settings prop of the visualization contains only one set of metrics and dimensions which by design is not sufficient for multiple cards. At the same time, not all cards settings contain saved "graph.dimensions" and "graph.metrics" so we have to get defaults if they are not present. ### How to verify This PR updates `e2e/test/scenarios/visualizations-charts/line-bar-tooltips.cy.spec.js` and `e2e/test/scenarios/visualizations-charts/line_chart.cy.spec.js` specs because they contained combined cards which failed before but work now. title: Exclude internal content from admin checklist and usage stats
body:
1. Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41335
2. Follows up on https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41522, excluding more things from anonymous usage stats: users, databases, tables, and fields. This new behaviour was approved [here](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C0641E4PB9B/p1713811895337679) on slack.

### Implementation details

I've created a new multimethod [`metabase.models.interface/exclude-internal-content-hsql`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/0b6ae3534cd94456699aed05ec0ebf4a4030576c/src/metabase/models/interface.clj#L724-L729) that is used in both `metabase.api.setup/state-for-checklist` and `metabase.analytics.stats/anonymous-usage-stats` to filter out internal content from their statistics and counts.

title: Re-wire the `PersistedModels` entity to use RTK Query under the hood
body:
Resolves #40797

The peculiarity of this particular migration is that there are two types of tags we need to invalidate. I think this reflects the confusing architecture of the (persisting) cache mechanism on the BE.

The main route is `/api/persist`.
- `list` will fetch all information about cached models, and each status has an ID (this generates `persisted-info` ID tags)
- there are two `get` methods
    - one is fetching an individual status (this corresponds to the `persisted-info` ID tag)
    - the other one is fetching a status for a particular model, using model's id (for this we're using a separate `persisted-model` ID tag)

Why is this needed?
Refreshing a model cache doesn't live on `/api/persist` but rather on `/api/card/model/:id/route`. The consequence is that the only id available from that refresh response is the model id. We CANNOT map model id to persisted info id, or we would run into wrong cache being invalidated.

Oh, and there's also `/api/database/:id/persist` endpoint ü§Ø
author: nemanjaglumac

title: support unpinning line charts from zero, pinning scatter charts to zero
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/7196 Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41977 ### Description Closes https://www.notion.so/metabase/Allow-non-zero-and-custom-y-axis-auto-ranges-b39801f44d35484daaa92132cd37d42b Makes possible to unpin line charts from zero. Scatter charts have been unpinned by default, now it is possible to pin them to zero as well. ### How to verify **Line chart** - Create a chart with range that does not start from zero - Ensure it is pinned to zero by default - Go to viz settings -> Axes -> Enable "Unpin from zero" - Ensure y-axis is unpinned from zero **Scatter chart** - Create a chart with range that does not start from zero - Ensure it is unpinned from zero by default - Go to viz settings -> Axes -> Disable "Unpin from zero" - Ensure y-axis is pinned to zero **Area/Bar/Combo** - Only if all series display is set to line the setting will appear **Waterfall** No such setting, it does not make sense ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: alxnddr

title: fix waterfall timezone issues and incorrect bar widths when total is enabled
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41551 ### Description Waterfall bar width did not account for the Total bar on time series and numeric scales which led to thick overlapping bars. During the review Emmad found that bars look weirdly shifted and bars are overlapping. The issue was that we did not apply x-axis date time transformations which I also implemented in this PR. ### How to verify ```sql SELECT '2022-01-01' x, 10 y union all SELECT '2022-01-02', 10 ``` ### Demo #### Bar widths Before After #### Correct timezone Dc.js This branch ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: Pivot table exports
body:
CSV exports of Pivot tables should now look like the table does in the App.

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/21064735/0484d51e-1754-480c-9897-7d1361ed7a9b)

This is done by post-processing the rows generated by the qp.pivot namespace. The postprocessing can be a little confusing at first, so I've tried hard to comment things nicely.

If you're reviewing this and want to have some repl-ready stuff to look at and try to understand a bit better, you can head to `metabase.api.downloads-exports-test`. At the bottom of that namespace I've put this in a comment form:

```clojure
(defn explore-pivot
    []
    (mt/dataset pivot-base-data
      (mt/with-temp [:model/Card {card-id :id}
                     {:display                :pivot
                      :visualization_settings {:pivot_table.column_split
                                               {:rows    [[:field "CAT C" {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                                          [:field "CAT D" {:base-type :type/Text}]]
                                                :columns [[:field "CAT A" {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                                          [:field "CAT B" {:base-type :type/Text}]]
                                                :values  [[:aggregation 0]]}}
                      :dataset_query          {:database (mt/id)
                                               :type     :query
                                               :query
                                               {:aggregation  [[:sum [:field (mt/id :pivot-base :measure) {:base-type :type/Integer}]]]
                                                :breakout
                                                [[:field (mt/id :pivot-base "CAT A") {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                                 [:field (mt/id :pivot-base "CAT B") {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                                 [:field (mt/id :pivot-base "CAT C") {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                                 [:field (mt/id :pivot-base "CAT D") {:base-type :type/Text}]]
                                                :source-table (mt/id :pivot-base)}}}]
        (let [result (->> (mt/user-http-request :crowberto :post 200 (format "card/%d/query/csv?format_rows=false" card-id))
                          csv/read-csv)]
          result))))
  ;; since the json export doesn't do any post processing, you can use that to see what the raw pivot rows look like:
  (defn explore-raw-pivot
    []
    (mt/dataset pivot-base-data
      (mt/with-temp [:model/Card {card-id :id}
                     {:display                :pivot
                      :visualization_settings {:pivot_table.column_split
                                               {:rows    [[:field "CAT C" {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                                          [:field "CAT D" {:base-type :type/Text}]]
                                                :columns [[:field "CAT A" {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                                          [:field "CAT B" {:base-type :type/Text}]]
                                                :values  [[:aggregation 0]]}}
                      :dataset_query          {:database (mt/id)
                                               :type     :query
                                               :query
                                               {:aggregation  [[:sum [:field (mt/id :pivot-base :measure) {:base-type :type/Integer}]]]
                                                :breakout
                                                [[:field (mt/id :pivot-base "CAT A") {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                                 [:field (mt/id :pivot-base "CAT B") {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                                 [:field (mt/id :pivot-base "CAT C") {:base-type :type/Text}]
                                                 [:field (mt/id :pivot-base "CAT D") {:base-type :type/Text}]]
                                                :source-table (mt/id :pivot-base)}}}]
        (let [result (mt/user-http-request :crowberto :post 200 (format "card/%d/query/json?format_rows=false" card-id))]
          (take 20 result)))))
```



Which, when paired with the `pivot-base-data` defined in that test namespace, lets you see what the output rows should look like.
author: adam-james-v

title: fix breakout charts with nulls and empty strings
body: Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41610 ### Description Fix charts crash when breakout column has both `null` and `""` values. Previously existing behavior is far from being ideal, but fixing it is out of the scope of this project. Basically, we show both breakout series as `(empty)` and they share the same series settings values. At least, this shows the creator that query should be tweaked to either filter out some of these breakout values or group them together. ### How to verify Create a native query ```sql select 1 x, '' b, 10 y union all select 1, null, 10 ``` Ensure it shows two different series ### Demo ### Checklist - [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

title: add validated migration checksums to v45 v46 v47 and v48
body:
(once this is backported) resolves #41641

Somehow the liquibase checksums changed and this was blocking downgrades for databases that were setup before ~v46.

Liquibase uses checksums to track changes in the database schema via changesets. The checksum is used to detect whether a changeset has been modified since it was last applied, ensuring that your database schema is consistent with your Liquibase configuration.

We suspect something in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/34400 caused the computed checksums to change.

I've gone through and added the newly computed checksums so that dbs started before v46 can perform downgrades from 49 -> 48.

You can verify this by running the following jars with the following commands:

```
# start before the liquibase version upgrade that Changed their Hashing Method (or v46-ish)
java -jar metabase_0.45.3.jar  

# then go to 49
java -jar metabase_0.49.6.jar  

# migrate back to 48
java -jar metabase_0.49.6.jar migrate down

# finally, running 48 should work:
java -jar metabase_0.48.5.jar 
```

- [x] backport to 49
- [x] backport to 48


note: If they Change their Hashing Function again, the script I used to rewrite the migrations file is [here](https://gist.github.com/escherize/cd443e8d0412d90ce602f9ba369b39a4).
author: escherize

title: Add console.trace() when capturing console error
body:
When capturing calls to `console.error()`, we run the real `console.error()` function inside console.js. But then we don't see the file / line number that gave rise to the error - instead, `console.error()` reports console.js as the file. So let's do `console.trace()` as well, to give devs better information.

(Note that we don't always see a diagnostic screen when a console error is captured - sometimes we see a "You can't see this" screen.)

After:

![image](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/assets/130925/4c0b39c6-c05c-433d-a9c6-77320bffb3d3)

title: Invalidate model caching when updating upload table
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41630

### Description

With this change we "bust" the related model caches when updating an uploaded table, to avoid surprising behavior where the updates are not visible when viewing those models or their derived questions.

We only consider "trivial" models which don't have any calculated columns, joins, filter, etc 

A gotcha with this approach, is that you are still given the option to update the table from models which *do* have all these potentially expensive operations applied, and then the user will still get the confusing experience of seeing their upload succeed, the question refreshing, and the new data still not being present.

You could argue that such non-trivial models should not expose an "upload" option anyway - I was surprised that they do.
author: crisptrutski
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]
comments_list:
[{'comment_id': 2067032619, 'issue_id': 2253529924, 'author': 'replay-io[bot]', 'body': '

Status In Progress ‚ÜóÔ∏é 51 / 52
Commit 9c68947653a48ebb32117fe189cf74afab7cd1f3

', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 19, 17, 46, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2067032996, 'issue_id': 2253529924, 'author': 'crisptrutski', 'body': 'Digression, based on my experience experimenting with these features. Rather than having magic behavior on the server side, as a (power) user I would far prefer it if the UI just made it more obvious what was going on, and gave me levers to pull to get what I wanted: 1. Indicate when caches were used.[^1] 2. Indicate when the underlying tables have data newer than the caches.[^2] 3. Give an option to invalidate the relevant caches.[^3] [^1]: For example the "More Info" section, or a new icon with say some hover text, could show all the models whose caches were used, along with the last update time of their cache. Alternatively a simplified version would just show the oldest timestamp. [^2]: Knowing when tables in general were last updated is hard, but it's trivial for uploaded tables. [^3]: An action to invalidate the caches would be the same as toggling the caching off and on again for a basic model, but as soon as you're talking about an arbitrary question querying cached models which themselves could depend on other cached models, which would need to be invalidated from bottom to top, the convenience factor would be a significant improvement. Additionally, I would not expect a cache to ever be populated or used for a "pass through" model (i.e. just select-table and nothing else). You can make an argument that limiting fields or rows will change query performance, but I don't see the value add for the "alias" models we create for Uploads. Finally, it seems very strange to me that querying a model which has been queued to be cached will not actually populate the cache. It seems surprising and dangerous that you will repeatedly query the underlying table in the gap between creating it and the next time the model refresh job is run, potentially hours later. Please take this drive by armchair critique with heaps of salt, as I'm still wet behind the ears on both the product and the codebase.', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 19, 17, 47, 13, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2069122810, 'issue_id': 2253529924, 'author': 'calherries', 'body': '> but I don't see the value add for the "alias" models we create for Uploads. Yeah, maybe we should turn off model caching for the models we create for uploads. title: Fix/improve list tags for paginated endpoints
body:
This PR is a follow-up after #41538.
According to [the documentation](https://redux-toolkit.js.org/rtk-query/usage/pagination#automated-re-fetching-of-paginated-queries), we need to provide a special type of the list tag called `PARTIAL-LIST` if we want the cache to work properly for the paginated endpoints.

This PR introduces new helper called `partialListTag`, and applies it to the `provideTaskListTags`.
Although there are other paginated endpoints, this PR doesn't deal with them now.
author: nemanjaglumac
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]

title: Add a new migration to clean up deprecated perm types
body:
This duplicates migration `v50.2024-03-24T19:34:11` which full removes the deprecated `data-access` and `native-query-editing` permission types from the app DB. (By this point in the migrations, they should be fully migrated to `view-data` and `create-queries`).

I'm adding a new one of these migrations because stats got into a strange state after deploying https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41581, where `data-access` permissions were left behind for a single table. This causes the BE to error when trying to fetch the perms graph.

The problematic table is a new app DB table that was also added in a migration, and then synced in stats since the app DB is also a connected data source. I'm still unpacking the sequence of events that led to the `data-access` perms for this table not being removed properly (it may have to do with reverting and then restoring the split data perms migration this week). But in the meantime, we can run the deletion migration again to fix stats. It should be idempotent for all other instances, so there shouldn't be any problem with running this twice.
author: noahmoss
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]

title: fix map panning and zooming is broken due to updated deps
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41605

### Description

Some transitive dependency that got updated in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/35118 broke pin maps panning and zooming, seems like the yarn.lock was removed and recreated. I took previously working yarn.lock and ran yarn install with new dependencies.

### How to verify

1. New question -> Sample Dataset -> People
2. Switch to map
3. Try panning and filtering via "Draw box to filter" button
4. Ensure it works

title: add "Setup embedding" to the admin setup checklist
body: This is part of the last milestone of [[Epic] Initial homepage experience for embedding admins](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/40005) It adds a new step in the setup checklist, as by [this design on figma](https://www.figma.com/file/UFay4YjWyUMyl23T1cXzeC/Meet-first-time-embedders-at-the-door-with-a-dashboard?type=design&node-id=1264-41762&mode=design&t=kepstwC5dDtNMEBt-4) I tried to make the code as coherent as I could to the rest of the files but I had to ask to my friendly local AI how to do some things in clojure so it's possible some things are not very idiomatic. The list item is set as done if any of the following: - the embedding homepage has been dismissed as "done" - a dashboard or a question has been published for static embedding - sso is configured and the authorized origin has been set (proxy for "interactive embedding is setup")
author: npretto
labels: [('.Team/Embedding', '')]

One property that it is checking is `sso`, but it's checking if `google-auth-enabled` is true, which seems a subset of sso? > > ```clojure > :sso (google/google-auth-enabled) > ``` Yes [we're aware of that](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/41638#discussion_r1572463694), for now I used the same logic as in the [anon stats](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/master/src/metabase/analytics/stats.clj#L139), but we have a plan to change them both at the same time with [Fix inconsistencies in SSO-related data points in anonymous usage stats](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Fix-inconsistencies-in-SSO-related-data-points-in-anonymous-usage-stats-4c615db48e044afeb092bdd7163c7344)", 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2024, 4, 29, 12, 22, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}]

title: Replace `isLoggedIn` and `isInitialized` with `LoginStatus`
body:
### Description Replaces `isLoggedIn` and `isInitialized` with more descriptive login states:
`uninitialized` the initial state, before any checks, logic, or anything
`initialized` API key or JWT URI have been loaded and all data looks good before making the first API request.
`loading` state until we've reached a resolved state, while we're fetching JWT tokens or user data
`error` if we're unable to fetch the token or user data, we use this state and include a message property that we can warn/error on users
`success` Everything is good!
The SDK flow would look something like this: - Status is `uninitialized` - `useInitData` is called. The API class is populated with API key or JWT provider URI. Status is set to `initialized`. - `error` if the auth type is invalid or API key/provider URI are invalid - The first API calls are made. State set to `loading` - Then we either get: - `error` with a relevant message if: - JWT token can't be fetched: JWT token cannot be fetched or something like that - current user can't be found: Invalid {JWT/API key} - cannot authenticate with Metabase - `success` if - We're able to authenticate and receive current user data _What does this mean?_ We can more easily control what to display based on the states. For the loading state, we can show a loading spinner within the islands of each component, ensuring that users can still display their own components and data while our components are loading. Or, if there's a login error, we can show a relevant error message with a customizable SDK component. You can see a demonstration of this in the `PublicComponentWrapper` component. I'd say there's improvements to be made in terms of wrapping each of the public display components but I think it's a good start. Using this component will also allow us to prevent components from rendering or making unnecessary API calls until the user is actually authenticated. _Note_ This doesn't necessarily mean we need to stop using `isLoggedIn` as a selector. Sometimes we only need to know that the user is authenticated, so the selector is just modified to use the login status. ### How to verify The client application and SDK still work with JWT and API keys.
author: oisincoveney
labels: [('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]

title: Fix not sending necessary HTTP headers when downloading results
body:
Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39848

Related to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/18823

### Description

This fix the problem where users logged in via Google SSO couldn't download question results. This was because we call `fetch` directly without passing the proper CSRF header which is required when we authenticate with `metabase.EMBEDDED_SESSION` cookie like Google SSO in this case. That is why we got 401 in the response.

### How to verify

1. Follow the repro steps in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/39848

2. Ensure [Fix download full results link for embedded and public questions](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/34659#top) is still working

    To set up subpath. Use https://github.com/WiNloSt/metabase-subpath. The instruction is already in the repo.

### Checklist

- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
author: WiNloSt
labels: [('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]
